title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI)
Interview Descriptions: Interview process is efficient and effective with first interview being with coordinator/recruiter, and with the second being with a team in relation to what you are applying for. Other than that, great organization and average interview questions.
Interview Questions: What is the most challenging thing you have experienced working within a team?

title: Program Advisor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI)
Interview Descriptions: Multi series process that in life’s two interviews. One zoom call, followed by a final round of interviews that lasted over 4 hours and included a presentation. This was well set up and conducted well. I loved being given the questions ahead of time to gain a better understanding in what they were looking for.
Interview Questions: What is your five year plan?

title: Employer Relations Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI)
Interview Descriptions: 1st round screening interview over zoom, 2nd round in-person interview day with multiple panel interviews. Assigned to complete a mock resume review + email communication to student, create and present a presentation on a career-related topic
Interview Questions: How do you handle/prioritize multiple projects?

title: Programmer II Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI)
Interview Descriptions: Laid back, given some coding problems (PHP, python, etc) and time to solve them. Wasn't very difficult. Process only consisted of one interview and I got the offer on the spot.
Interview Questions: Give an example of a PHP query that would accomplish such-and-such goal

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Made it to first round, submitted a code sample with an explanatory document. Interviewers were very nice, asked reasonable questions, it was a pleasant experience. They were clear and up front about the interview process, and timeline for employment.
Interview Questions: Asked about relevant stack experience, ci/cd familiarity, etc.

title: Director IT Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI)
Interview Descriptions: Urgent scheduling with multiple calls/contact points to schedule interview within a day or two, then zero follow up afterward. Ideal situation would have involved a follow up email stating position was closed, filled, etc to close the loop.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your background and why you're interested in this position.

title: Student Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI)
Interview Descriptions: This was for the LSA career center - two staff members interviewed me in a small room in the office. Since I was applying to help out with their comms, they asked about my experience doing comms at other student orgs, as well as aptitude for writing, graphics software, social media, etc.
Interview Questions: Can you tell me about how you went about creating a newsletter for (student org I was involved in)?

title: Student Building Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan (Dearborn, MI)
Interview Descriptions: Had an interview with the Assistant Director after my application was reviewed and selected. The interview duration was 30 mins. The interview was a one on one interview. The result of the interview was conveyed quickly.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and share your strengths and weakness

title: Social Work Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: They provide you with questions that require you to create 3 unique presentations and then they have you participate in a Q&A with multiple staff members. Afterwards you interview with director.
Interview Questions: How do you work under a multicultural lens

title: Database Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: 1. first round - Excel data challenge, 5 days to complete 2. about a week to hear back from them 3. second round - 45 min video interview 4. 2 weeks of waiting 5. third round - 2h penal interview & presentation
Interview Questions: regular behavioral questions and some technical ones

title: Behavioral Health Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: HR recruiter screen was great, next phase felt a bit disorganized (no room scheduled, one of the interviewers didn’t no my background and made clear I was not the right fit after one question).
Interview Questions: Describe a mistake you’ve recently made

title: Gym Coordinator/Building Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Sit and talk to the director and manager of the building. They will ask behavioral questions to make sure you are a great fit for the team. After that, the team will try to reach out as soon as they can to let you know if they want to hire you.
Interview Questions: Q. How would you deal with a coworker who is slacking in their role.

title: Office Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Interview questions were fair and casual. Calm atmosphere and 1on1. Most questions were targeted to interviewees skills and reason for joining. Second half of interview was based on explaining the job and tasks involved.
Interview Questions: 1. Tell me about why you are interested in the job

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very tough ebcause they asked a bunch of difficult questions. I think it could have been easier with better questions but the questions were not the best.
Interview Questions: Why Michigan is the best

title: Storyteller Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: For the interview process, I met virtually with a recruiter for an interview over Zoom to talk about the role as well as what I would bring to the table in this position.
Interview Questions: To elaborate on my previous experience.

title: Teacher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was easy and made me go through multiple interviews to get selected in the final round. There was a lot of challenging questions at first, however, I was able to respond to the questions to the best of my ability.
Interview Questions: what made you want to work with us

title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: laid back with basic questions. Come prepared with answers to the typical questions like "why do you want to do this?" Overall, you're pretty much guaranteed a position if you have taken the class before.
Interview Questions: What is your current GPA?

title: Data Entry Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Very easy, get-to-know you types of questions, laid-back. There wasn't really anything technical asked, just making sure i was motivated and actually wanted the job, since lots of campus jobs are more for just studying
Interview Questions: They really only asked about you, and maybe a few behavioral questions

title: Career Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Screening interview with hiring manager + director. This was held virtually over zoom Final round: emailed resume review, Behavior interview with Hiring manager + HR + team, behavior interviews with school partners, sample student presentation. Ideally this would have been in person, but it was held in a series of zoom meetings. For the final round, was provided with a few questions and additional topics to prepare for- this was not all the questions, but it was very transparent what to expect.
Interview Questions: What is your preferred advising/coaching style and why? What do you see as a current employment trend facing  students? What are your goals for contributing to DEI at the Career Development Office,  and U-M? Given the fact that  students' career goals and employer/industry interests are extremely diverse and not the most traditional, how do you plan on learning career and employer/industry content to support students' career goals?

title: Medical Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Informal interview; know your application, be engaged and excited. Mix of one-on-one interviews and MMIs. They try to pair you with someone with similar interests. Sometimes current medical students can interview.
Interview Questions: Why Michigan? Tell me about yourself.

title: Research and Development Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Michigan in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: Average interview, they kept reminding me that they keep a standard format for 'equality purposes'. Wasted my time by not following up and acted rude and condescending when I reached out for an update nearly a month later. Overall disrespectful despite a facade of equality and respect.
Interview Questions: Standard stuff. Tell me about a time you worked as a member of a team.

title: Research Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: I attended a couple of interviews for other positions at UMich and they were usually with direct manager and very straight forward. They expect objective and clear answers. I received two job offers and accepted one. HR processing takes longer than average for other companies.
Interview Questions: They asked about personal/professional challenges, what do I do to be organized, how do I deal with conflict, how do I respond to stress, etc.

title: Grad Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was not as intense as other schools. The faculty and students are extremely nice. Enjoy them and the area as you are being flown out to meet with these people.
Interview Questions: What is a challenge you have been faced with and how did you overcome it?

title: Researcher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: i had to submit questions and a portfolio, I got back a decision within a some weeks. before that however I needed to participate in a study which was a week long process to even partcipate. Not hard but not easy due to how tedious it was
Interview Questions: What draws you to be a researcher at Umich?

title: Adjunct Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: They were consistently professional with keeping me (the applicant) informed with my status and the process. This was a positive experience, and because of that I will continue to apply to more positions at this institution.
Interview Questions: Tell me a bit about yourself.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: Application Review Contact Interview Technical Round on Programming Previous work template check/writing samples Team Members check-in, meet and greet Reference check HR Round: pay and timeline discussion Offer Work review
Interview Questions: more behavioral in initial rounds

title: Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Michigan in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was pleasantly surprised to get a Zoom interview very quickly with the hiring manager and someone on the team. I was told I would hear back within a week, possibly later the same week. That was over a month ago, and despite one polite email and one polite voicemail, they have not bothered to provide any kind of update or closure on the position.
Interview Questions: Very basic questions which they said they sent ahead of time. They sent them late and apologized for that, but I still felt great about how the interview went. Yet I was ghosted.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Michigan in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: No interview was asked to come work for a teacher as a research assistant after turning in a senior design project. They were happy with what my team and I turned in and wanted us to continue working on that project.
Interview Questions: Are you available to work 10 to 20 hours a week?

title: Residential College Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Despite the RC being a welcoming and friendly place, the fact that it is part of the larger U-M institution really hindered what the interview process could have been. The interview was cut-and-dry, question and answer, with little room for conversation or the candidate's personality to shine through. I appreciate that interviewers at U-M provide candidates with the list of questions at the beginning of each interview so that candidates can process what's being asked and don't need to ask interviewers to repeat the question.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you took a risk.

title: Research Lab Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Meet the supervisor to talk about your work experience. It's better to prepare some slides to introduce the projects you have involved. They will ask you questions during your presentation to see what you can do and what you can learn in the future.
Interview Questions: Questions related to your previous experience

title: Spanish Communications Interview
Application Type: The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Bad experience. First interview was supposed to be 3 people. Only 1 people showed. Second interview was a panel with 4 people from the team. It was good, they asked many questions but they never reached out to me about the outcome. Unprofessional. Big institution but they don't take peoples time seriously. Enough with this interviews. Be better.
Interview Questions: Why didn't work for the past 6 months?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Meeting the team and half day working rotation. Interacting with prior year interns who became employees. Sharing a 10 min presentation on toughest moments leading upto internship at univ of Michigan.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 Yrs

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: They made me feel comfortable and I felt valued. They asked questions to truly understand me and my body of work experience. They also valued my creativity which is good.
Interview Questions: How did you learn about this position?

title: Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Presentation on research work to the supervisor's group, and letters of recommendation (3 min required). An informal Q and A conducted which lasted for about an hour, followed by research presentation, followed by letters of reco.
Interview Questions: Related to research and how would I fit into the group

title: Medical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: Comfortable interview with core lab manager and lab supervisor. Lab supervisor is very personable and made the tone of the interview very comfortable. Questions were straightforward. Asked if I was happy with my career choice, how I handle pressure, the usual interview questions. Explained the position accurately and made sure I was comfortable with it.
Interview Questions: How do you handle pressure?

title: Janitor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI)
Interview Descriptions: It was a fun one. They tested my skills and asked thought provoking questions. Not too difficult, make sure you dress well! You can even interview for other rolls at the same time.
Interview Questions: Why are you a good fit for this roll?

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: The process took less than one month which included one phone interview with the supervisor and a reference check. The interview lasted nearly one hour and I received an update via email within a week.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in the position, what is your experience with managing datasets.

title: Math Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: It was just an application and the interview was very chill. We just discussed the role and the responsibilities I would have. Then, I was asked if I had a similar experience before and any forms I had to fill out after being accepted.
Interview Questions: Which days are you available to work?

title: Instructional Aide Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Met with the professors twice over zoom, a different professor each time, and answered their questions and then did mock office hours where the professor acts as a student asking questions.
Interview Questions: What’s something that could be improved in the class?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Very nice people interviewed me and I enjoyed it it was pretty standard we just held a mock office hours and they asked some behavioral questions. I felt welcome and it ws a good experience
Interview Questions: What do you want this job

title: Patient Services Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview. Then an in person interview with manager and supervisor. Usually there is 3 people present during the interview but something came up with one of the supervisors. It was a very simple interview process.
Interview Questions: What is my greatest weakness and my greatest strength

title: Audio Visual Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Pretty straight forward. I enjoyed it, I had two interviews and they lasted about one hour and half each. 5 people in the zoom, all of them were nice and they made me feel comfortable
Interview Questions: The same as usual, what do you expect, why that job, etc.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Detroit, MI) in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: On my application, the University HR contacted me through email. inform me regarding my shortlisting and asked convent time for interview. they give me three time slots from which i have to select one. i opt according to my convenient and interview was conduct by the professor. it was conducted online through zoom app.
Interview Questions: Your Education? Your Previous experience

title: Workday Learning Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: It was a long interview process. There were a lot of steps to take in order just to get the first interview. They did get back to me quickly after the interviews were over.
Interview Questions: They asked mostly about Campaigns and Report Writer

title: Shared Services Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Fantastic. It was so great to work for them, they provided an easy onboarding process and were very friendly in teaching the position. I would recommend working here for anyone.
Interview Questions: What is your background in diversity?

title: Academic Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Team interview and then an interview with leadership. They will ask specific questions about curriculum and ideas or how you’ve helped in other successful courses. They were very welcoming to telling me about the role and how this role would interact within the department.
Interview Questions: How were you involved in curriculum planning in your past experiences?

title: Field Interviewer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan (New York, NY) in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: Waiting for my call back but my preliminary interview was great. I was made to feel very comfortable and the interviewer was kind and generous with her words. I believe it went well. I waiting for my call back I hope it comes soon. I'm very excited to learn more about the study.
Interview Questions: I have been in this field for 30 years so for the most part it was more of me hearing more about the study.

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: The process is as expected for the role. Must have proved your knowledge after receiving a good grade in a prior semester and be able to be flexible with hours.
Interview Questions: Do you have leadership experience?

title: Degree Apprentice Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: The interview was great, good ambient. It is a good place to study and learn, i will recomend it. Try it here, you will learn a lot with the interview they have.
Interview Questions: What do i want for my life?

title: Multimedia Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Michigan in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: Process was well organized. Human Resources sent questions in advance of the interviews and provided information on what to expect at each stage of the interview process. Interview follow-ups and information about next steps were timely.
Interview Questions: From your experience, tell me about a time you have seen benefits from diversity in the workplace.

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Professional, decent questions, and did not have much pressure associated with it. The interviewer asked questions that related to both my previous job and what the new job would entail.
Interview Questions: About my previous background in healthcare.

title: Service Center Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions:
The process leading up to the interview was fine, the interview itself was an absurd waste of time. 

I spend several days organizing my thoughts and talking to people about their interview questions and then I have this phone interview that was a total joke. They asked ridiculous questions, none pertaining to my work experience and it was immediately apparent to me that they already had other people in mind and I was there so they could say they’d interviewed multiple candidates. I’ve held high views of U of M so this was grotesque and disappointing to say the least.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time when someone gave you great customer service?

title: Energy Conservation Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: The interview was set up with a short notice, but it is relatively well organized. The interview team is professional and provides good feedback. Overall it is a good interview experience.
Interview Questions: General discussions about background and position

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Michigan in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: starts with BQ and ask about your project, one of the interviewer asked about how to deal with the missing data and tell your what's their data set and the workflow
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: HR screen + panel + individual interviews made up the process. I was impressed with the level of detail provided. I thought the staff were knowledgable, but the leadership structure did not impress.
Interview Questions: Standard interview questions were asked

title: Research Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: Simple interview going through experience of past research and past activities. Asked a few questions and communicated back and forth. Not super difficult and basic preparation is adequate. Good luck.
Interview Questions: Describe previous research experience, describe previous experience in the field

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Online recordings, there were videos to guide you through and help you with the process. You could record as many times as you wanted before moving on to the next question.
Interview Questions: What have your past experiences been?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: One phone interview and four additional interviews over video software. Fairly basic questions each time, some repetitive. Scheduling over email. Was nice to not have to attend in person and deal with parking.
Interview Questions: Describe your time management techniques

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and then was reached out to by an employee a few weeks later. There was one video interview about 30 min long, asked the expected and common questions. Talked about the projects at the center and what I would be placed on.
Interview Questions: Describe how you worked through a conflict

title: Licenciado en Administración Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Detroit, MI) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: un proceso largo, que llevo a varias instancias que se dividia en etapas por un par de horas con conexion por medio de la red social de skype y asi sucesivamente podia llegar a a la instancia final
Interview Questions: personal question and about my experience

title: Referral Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Wyoming, MI) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: Very thorough.  Very specific questions pertaining to the job.  There were 2 midlevel managers present as well as a current referral specialist in the room.  Very good questions that made me feel I was in my wheel house
Interview Questions: How do I feel working with cancer patients knowing that not all patients survive?

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions:
Screener called me and told me I'd get a video interview with HR. Screener emailed me back and spelled my name completely wrong in the invite. I politely pointed this out and it was never changed nor did they apologize.
Video interview questions with HR were all irrelevant. I asked the interviewer for more insight about day-to-day duties and she just read verbatim from the posting. I sent a thank you note and she said she'd follow up in a week. No notice for 3 weeks until I had to remind them, at which point I found out I was not selected.
Interview Questions: How are you a solution seeker?

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: first on site interview took about 2 hours, talking with senior researcher in the group. Second was with the PI and the lead research of the project. Basic background and technical questions and other common questions were asked.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in the next 5 years?

title: Customer Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: There were multiple panel interviews for this position that were at minimum of an hour each. Questions were scenario based. Interviews seemed to go well and the conversations were positive.
Interview Questions: What is one problem that you were presented with that you were able to solve from start to finish?

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: light interviews on administrative practices and potential work duties, met with a few of the office members I'd be working with to ensure a good rapport, process was fine overall
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you completed a project successfully

title: Marketing Communications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Always a terrible experience… the process is always dragged out to 3 to 4 interviews and then it takes 6 months to hear back anything from them… not much else to say.
Interview Questions: Behavioral questions - expecting STAR method answers

title: Graduate Student Instructor (GSI) Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Straight forward. You mostly have to meet the requirements. The department will give the job on a first come first serve basis. Interview is more of filling out paperwork. No questions or anything like that in a standard interview. I'm not sure if you have to be a graduate student or not.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Student Instructor (GSI) Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions:
Different for each department and professor. 

For a psychology GSI position I was asked to "pitch myself" in a zoom meeting with the other candidates. It was a little intimidating but the instructor made things more comfortable.
Interview Questions: "Pitch Yourself - why should you get the job?"

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions:
Interviewed for a software developer position. The interview was done over Bluejeans and went primarily over my experience and career plans, as well as some technical details around the position and expected work.

Each interviewer was someone I would interact with daily. And everyone was professional and provided me with ample time to ask questions.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have with container orchestration?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with supervisor an then sets 2 of 3 Medical assistants. Interview wasn't hard they made me feel comfortable. Everyone was friendly.  I heard back within one week of interviewing
Interview Questions: How well was I with having to work in other areas

title: Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was 3 rounds with different people at various levels. There was a presentation. Not much time for questions. The hiring process took several weeks. They communicated by email the entire time.
Interview Questions: How are you committed to DEI?

title: Scholarship Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was good.  Less intensive that i would expect for U of M. The questions were all very basic interview questions with a focus on diversity and working with other departments.
Interview Questions: What experience have you had working with a diverse population?

title: Part Time Cashier Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions:
no in person interview process needed. Applications from online, a short interview via zoom might be required after the application. It is very easy, straight forward process. 
Nothing complicated during interview after the applications.
Interview Questions: The previous work experience related questions

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Held a phone pre-screen interview, then a Zoom interview. The interviewer was very respectful and asked straight forward questions regarding my experience in past jobs. The interview lasted 30 minutes.
Interview Questions: Can you talk about a role you've held that required stellar time management?

title: Football Team Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: No process, sign up or inquire with a coach, and hope they pick you to come back. Be knowledgeable about football. very.  It takes more luck than anything to get in a role like this
Interview Questions: How can you help us

title: Graduate Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was organized, efficient and not particularly difficult. I was surprised by how quickly the process went and how fast an offer was made. I had my second interview and was made an offer within twenty-four hours.
Interview Questions: What work have you done in the DEI space?

title: College Admittant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: I called someone over the phone and we discussed what life was like at the University of Michigan. I had some time to ask questions at the end and overall it was a helpful and pleasant experience.
Interview Questions: Why would you like to come to the University of Michigan?

title: Instructional Designer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Long interview process - be prepared for 1/2 day or more. Met with many people, overall very nice. University was beautiful and welcoming. Lots of short interviews with multiple people.
Interview Questions: What theories and frameworks impact your design processes?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very smooth. Everyone I interacted was kind and professional. I felt very comfortable asking questions and felt that I could be myself. If asked, I would interview here again.
Interview Questions: Describe a particularly difficult situation and how you handled it.

title: Graduate Student Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: I did well academically. Some professors seeking research assistants posted their positions to my department. Based on my academic records, I was selected as potential candidates. I then met with my supervisor.
Interview Questions:
What courses did you take?  
What kind of research did you conduct?
What is your research goal?
What kind of researcher do you want to become?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: The interview process consisted of two rounds with the manager who did a very good job with explaining the role and responsibilities. The questions were very average and flexible about remote work.
Interview Questions: Can you describe a time where you dealt with an unhappy community partner?

title: Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: In depth, but appropriate for what the job is. Did not have anything too crazy or unexpected that came up. Felt like a typical health care interview with many questions
Interview Questions: What experience do you have

title: Labor Relations Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was on zoom, two people.  Very professional.  Delightful conversation.  We spoke for roughly 45 minutes, scenario-based on prior experience.  The questions were thought-provoking and fair, with no curve balls.
Interview Questions: Tell us a time that you had to work with people who were actively trying to undermine the purpose of your position.

title: Cognition Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Brief, and general questions. The interviewer was kind and asked about my background and skillset. I prepared questions from online research and asking peers about their experience, I got the position and worked there for a year.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you had to make a difficult decision at work.

title: Student Nurse Extern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Hireview screening questions for initial interview then second round is in person and asks situational and behavioral questions-- ex tell me about a time you dealt with a difficult patient
Interview Questions:
tell me about yourself
 tell me about a time you dealt with a difficult patient
why michigan medicine 
why nursing

title: Director of Operations Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: 3 Rounds. Two in person, and one over zoom. Took a very long time to hear back, kept me in the dark. I wish it would have been more clear.
Interview Questions: They asked me if I was  a procrastinator?

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: Common interview questions, friendly people, quick responses, but they are looking for people with perfect fit in background. Hard to answer some questions without direct experience.  But HR takes the longest time compare with interview period.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Administrative Assistant Intermediate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Rochester Hills, MI) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions:
Cover letter, many questions about being in challenging situations and reflecting on what was the out come.

It was a pool interview with 3 people from the college itself  and last about 1 hour in total.  30 minutes of introductions and questions and the remainder to ask about the position and question the interviews
Interview Questions: Why this position indeed of the others?

title: School of Education Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Interviewers were professional and friendly which helped calmed my nerves. Interview was conducted over Zoom and lasted roughly 30 minutes. They spent a few minutes going over the role, asking questions and then left a chunk of time for me to ask questions at the end.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at UM?

title: Janitor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: It was good. very relaxed. just want to make sure you'll be a productive worker. when coming in, I was greeted professionally and given a walk through of my job duties. it was a laid back experience and the interviewer was very nice and welcoming.
Interview Questions: why are you applying for this job

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: I can't adequately describe the interview process and I would hesitate to do so in thirty words. It was very thorough and informative. Descriptive of the job and it's requirements.
Interview Questions: There were not any questions

title: Qualitative Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: Easy interview, asked questions about the company and job position. Just do your research before applying. The interview lasted 30min-45min.  There was only one round with the program manager for the education consultancy firm I was applying to.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Engaging. Introduces me to the research project. Would be a plus if you have a strong relevant background and looks interested in the material. Prepare some questions ahead of the interview.
Interview Questions: Q. What relevant CS project have you been involved in?

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Very helpful, had a wholistic approach to getting to know the applicant. Enjoyed being interviewed by them, showed me facilities on the first day, everyone warm and friendly. Received an offer on the spot
Interview Questions: What were your prior research experiences?

title: Laboratory Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: There was a Phone Interview and a Zoom Interview.  These took place two months apart. Email responses would take multiple weeks after the interviews which contributed to the length of interview process.  Zoom interview was well organized for being online. Communication could have been better.
Interview Questions: About current job position duties

title: Tutor/Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: I was informally interviewed by the department head who then scheduled another interview with himself, the director I would be working under, and my direct supervisor. The entire interview process took place on the same day online.
Interview Questions: They mainly gave me free rein to talk about my life, work, and academic path.

title: UMP Press Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview was cordial, professional, efficient, and conducted over ZOOM, and being on-camera was optional. I believe every applicant invited to the interview process was asked the exact same questions.
Interview Questions:
Q: How did you keep your team motivated throughout the pandemic?
Q: Define diversity.
Q: How do you make decisions when there are organizational budget adjustments?

title: Grad Student Interviews, STEM Majors Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: They promised me a spot, got me excited, then denied me. That was fun. The people were very kind and encouraging, but in the end made promises that should not have been made. It is ok to deny someone, but not after promising them a position.
Interview Questions: Just asked about research opportunities and what I wanted from grad school

title: Graduate Student Instructor (GSI) Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Apply online and maybe you get an unofficial interview with the professor who teaches the class. And also you need to upload references and transcripts.  And then you wait to hear if you get the job. They typically only hire PhD candidates
Interview Questions: How did you like the class when you took it?

title: GSRA Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Take the GRE. Prepare the C.V.  Request the recommendation letter. Get a high score. Take the interview. Meet with professor. Get the admission. Start to work and take the course.
Interview Questions: Are you interested in the project?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: The interview process as a whole took about 3 months but was pretty easy questions that came from a bulk of questions from what seemed like the internet. More situational questions
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you disagreed with a co-worker and how you handled it

title: Student Peer Mentor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: The interview is conducted in a group for around 30 minutes. Each person will be presented with 2-3 questions about why they are a good fit for the role and why they are a strong candidate.
Interview Questions: What is one thing you like about the university?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI)
Interview Descriptions: through UROP it was a 1 on 1 with a professor. going over resume and discussing experiences. not much to prepare for here just be enthusiatic and willing to listen and learn.
Interview Questions: favorite thing you have learned in school

title: Peer Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: One round group interview required. Interview was done with other applicants who may not apply to be the tutor for the same course. Therefore no technical questions were asked. Soft skills were discussed.
Interview Questions: What would you do if students kept asking you questions through email outside your working time?

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Application submitted online. Called for Onsite interview. Had to give presentation. Meet collaborators, gradate students.  Visit labs and interact with other faculties. Was introduced to what is currently done in the group and go over the projects I will be working on.
Interview Questions: talk about the projects that you have done

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Michigan in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: They explained thoroughly about the job but you are expected to come prepared about what you will do if you get the job. Come up with suggestions of programs you want to implement beforehand would be helpful.
Interview Questions: What was an open ended question you received this week?

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: Applied on the job application website, received an email from the supervisor. They scheduled a Zoom interview with the individual that would be the supervisor in the position. Shortly after, I received feedback and an offer.
Interview Questions: How would I approach conflict in the workplace?

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Michigan in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: There were two persons in the interview board. Questions related to PhD research were asked. There were some general questions as well. Experiences on simulation software were a primary requirement.
Interview Questions: How will you ensure accessible transportation?

title: PhD Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Normal interview, zoom with professors and they ask about your experience, interests, etc. focusing on previous research experience, especially if it's within the area. Idk this is standard for grad interviews.
Interview Questions: Describe your previous research experience.

title: Student Grader Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Sent an email to the administrator and asked a few questions via email. Easy to get the offer. will notify you before the semester start. Need patient for grading job though.
Interview Questions: What is your impression of this course?

title: Post Doctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: I had to give a presentation and met with all the lab members. Everyone was really nice. It was a great interview, and a great institution. Also got a tour of the campus and research labs
Interview Questions: Questions specific to my research and methods

title: Service Management Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: There were 2 rounds of interviews. The first one is a phone call with my direct supervisors, and the second one is an onsite interview with the same people on the phone call.
Interview Questions: Questions are more behavioral questions include how did you solve a technical problem?

title: Microbiologist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Buffalo, NY) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: it was hard n i was stressing because of my shyness n also they was looking me in my eyes to much which had me more nervus n i had to learn how to go over that so next time ill get the job
Interview Questions: why do you want to work here

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: Long, arduous interview process. This was over Zoom during the pandemic, but I had 4 separate interviews - screening, interview with chair/assoc chair, meeting with coworkers, and final interview with department manager. I also had to get my current employer to agree to a reference - which would have been awful if I didn't get the job.
Interview Questions: Standard interview questions. Nothing I hadn't heard before.

title: Urban Planner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: The process was clear, the interviewers were engaging and excited about my skills and experience. I thought it was a good fit and seemed like a good team to join.
Interview Questions: A lot of circumstantial questions: if you encountered X, how would you handle it.

title: Technology Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by two managers.  Heard back the same day with an offer. They are looking for a reliable employee who is a team player. The whole process took about two weeks for me. This time frame may also depend on the position or department you are applying to.
Interview Questions: A situation where you had to handle a problem.

title: Shared Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was a fantastic interview experience that left me very pleased with the overall leadership of the department and made me feel very welcomed and accepted. They are committed to their employees and it shows.
Interview Questions: What is your commitment to diversity?

title: Chaplain Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview. A host and variety of questions were asked starting from history, experience, strengths, weaknesses,  plans for the future coupled with examples from visits. Interest regarding furthering education and what are the  plans if doing so.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself and why chaplaincy?

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Extremely intriguing and typical to interview led consulting interviews. Extremely similar to normal style casing interviews that would be at different companies. Overall, a pretty rigorous but fun experience and really prepares you for a typical case interview that you will see at companies
Interview Questions: Walk me through your resume

title: Research Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Canton, MI) in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: Discussed my expectations from the job and required skills for the position. I was given an overview of what to expect. Career advancement possibilities were also discussed. The next step was talking to the lab members to see if it was a good fit for all of us.
Interview Questions: For how long was I ready to commit?

title: DEI Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: It was pretty standard. They asked me to describe myself and why I wanted the role. They asked about my experience with customer service and working in a team setting. It wasn't stressful.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your experience working with databases.

title: Security Guard Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Very easy process, I was interviewed on a nice Saturday morning. There ain't no sunshine, and it was a vibe. There were two people asking questions. I enjoyed the interview process very much.
Interview Questions: How much are you able to bench?

title: Facilities Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Buffalo, NY) in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: Zoom one on one with HR person to review opportunities and my skill set match.  30 minutes in length with little content that was of factual interest to one that would want to be able to determine what job they wanted
Interview Questions: What year did you graduate from college?

title: Trainer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: The interfiew process was poor and no one returned emails even after i called and emailed several times.  They siad to be sure to contact them.  I never got a response
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Assistant In Research Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: The process was an informal conversation. We discussed my interested and how they aligned with the project. It was casual and questions were encouraged. Learned a lot about them, and they learned about me.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this project

title: Events Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Very simple, pleasant, the interviewer was nice and asked about my resume and some general interview questions such as strengths, weaknesses, why i am interested in the position and how it fits into career goals
Interview Questions: What are your strengths? Weaknesses?

title: Fiscal Specialist II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Seattle, WA) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: Multiple rounds across the span of a few days. I usually had an interview one day a week for three weeks. The groups got bigger as the process went on. Mine was virtual so it was really mellow.
Interview Questions: My experience level with some financial systems the job uses.

title: Transfer Student Ambassador Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Michigan in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: Very standard and easy interview. Casual questions About life and needing to be a transfer student. Why do you want to do this is something worth considering. You must be a Current student to.
Interview Questions: Why do I want to do this

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: They will email you to set a time then ask a bunch of questions. They are not that harsh, very behavioral related. I would suggest study your resume and practice what you think they might ask
Interview Questions: Deacribe one project you did

title: Librarian Position Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: This was a few years ago now but the interview process was pretty standard, if involved--there was a phone interview followed by a day-long campus interview with (mostly) groups of people in different areas of the library I might interact with. I was also asked to do a half-hour presentation followed by Q&A on a topic related to the job.
Interview Questions: (I don't remember specific questions)

title: Communications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Michigan in Jul 2020
Interview Descriptions: Basic online application. Started with a pre-interview questionnaire/project prior to the first interview. The first interview was a 45-minute Zoom meeting with the HR director and an institutional/functional peer. Second round was a 45-minute panel Zoom interview with three team members and a 30-minute Zoom panel with the faculty directors and HR director. The 45-minute interviews included 11-12 behavioral questions, leaving little time for the candidate to ask questions or get to know their interviewers. The 30-minute interviews a lot more conversational and easier to build a rapport.  They made me an offer, but had this strange "policy" where they needed to speak with my supervisor prior to me receiving an offer with a salary. Seemed fishy and was part of the reason I declined.
Interview Questions: Q: Tell me about a time where you had to navigate a project where the roadmap wasn't always clear.

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Michigan in Apr 2020
Interview Descriptions: Mostly behavioral with some situational / scenario questions to determine experience and skills. Offered examples from previous experiences and walked the interviewer through how I would manage a student confidentiality issue.
Interview Questions: What are your career goals moving forward.

title: Full Stack Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process went really well. I was interviewed by technical people who asked about my projects, some behavioral STAR style questions, etc. Overall it went well, just be confident and ready to talk about your projects
Interview Questions: Tell me about a challenge you've faced

title: Interview Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Much like any other interview. They ask pretty basic questions and test your computer literacy.  Its not a difficult interview and youre only speaking to one person, not a group.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Grand Rapids, MI) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: very relaxed, I interviewed with a hiring manager and met with the supervisor. the interview questions were fairly easy. The working environment also seems great however I had another better offer that I accepted.
Interview Questions: How would your previous employer describe you?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Easy, seamless, and professional. The interviewer was the supervisor of the Office of Student Affairs. It was a great experience at teaching me the right way to answer interview questions. I had a second in-person interview with the team and that process went smooth as well.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Dec 2019
Interview Descriptions: Nice department. Filled out the application online. Got contacted for a phone interview the day after the position had closed. Completed the phone interview that following week, then got contacted that same week for a in person interview. Interview was over 2 hours long. I had about 2-3 panel interviews, which included some of the staff and student workers. It was quite interesting how exhausting the process was, being that the position was a lot of work for very little pay. I got notified about 5 weeks later that I wasn’t offered the position. No explanation, just simply “You were not selected”. The position was then re-posted the following day. Overall process took several weeks, from the time I applied, had my interviews, to the time I was notified about the decision. The process took way longer than it should have. The department focuses heavily on promoting diversity, but has nothing to show for it.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a student that seems to be withdrawn from participating?

title: Resident Advisor (RA) Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: Had to take a class on sociology, diversity, and inclusion to be considered to become an RA then pass. Then you got to interview for the job with one of the hall directors.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a resident advisor?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: The department I interviewed within (Dept. of Psychology) made this interview so much more uncomfortable than it needed to be. This was for fairly uncomplicated front desk/admin position, and it was a panel interview of 8 people. Word of advice? If it's not a high-ranking position, don't overwhelm interviewees with a stodgy, panel-style interview conducted by your ENTIRE department.
Interview Questions: What would you bring to a staff potluck?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview was friendly but very professional. I didn't know I got the position right away, they had a poker face. But they were not intimidating or trying to be difficult, I just left wondering until they called to confirm.
Interview Questions: Tell us a little about yourself

title: IT Desktop Support Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Had a one-on-one interview with the manager and overall was a simple process. I was just asked a few questions and described my experience. The total interview only took about 20 or so minutes, very short.
Interview Questions: Describe one moment where you had to make a quick thinking decision on an incident.

title: Clinical Subject Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview process wasn’t too difficult. It took about an hour.  It was a typical interview. The asked a lot about my resume and asked about me as well as let me ask questions.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Information Technology Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: Casual and informal, single in-person interview (pre-pandemic), conducted in a public space in the museum by prospective manager. Low pressure, discussed past technical experiences and skills, goals and responsibilities for the position, and interest in working at the museum.
Interview Questions: Experience and comfort with specific technical skills or languages, reason for interest in museum

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Michigan in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: Long. You apply online and cross your fingers you hear from someone. Once you do, you're offered an interview, maybe a shadowing (new rules d/t covid) then if offered you can wait up to a month to actually start.
Interview Questions: Weaknesses, strengths, where do you see yourself in five years

title: Ra Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI)
Interview Descriptions: 1 interview with two assistant hall directors. It was a list of 10 questions  and I had the opportunity to look at all of them and answer them one by one. The interviewers were nice and it was a relaxed environment.
Interview Questions: How have you handled a conflict with a classmate

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: It was good. Onsite Interview at the offices. Make sure you know what's on your resume and can expand on it Employees seemed very nice and happy to work there. Unfortunately, I could not accept because of some personal issues.
Interview Questions: Describe a Project you are proud of?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: Interview was very chill. Consisted of a back and forth conversation in relation to the Professor's research and ways that I could contribute to their work. Additionally, we also talked about how the Professor could help me become a better researcher.
Interview Questions: How would you represent this data in a graph?

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very straight forward. You apply on the job posting side, then get an interview meeting where they ask very typical interview questions, and as long as you have some computer experience, you will be fine.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with an irate patron?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: Pretty casual, asked about education and employment history, talked about interests and why I wanted to work there, what work experience did I have that could help me contribute to ongoing research projects, heard about research projects that I could potentially work on.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Dearborn, MI) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions:
You have to complete the course with good grades for which you want to become the teaching assistant. 

The course is very good and interesting with lots of problems which helps you to understand the concepts clearly.
Interview Questions: The course exam is basically your interview

title: Telefund Caller Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: It's a really simple interview and they only expect you to be confident when reading over the script. You will come in to the office and after you will be do a phone interview within the next few days.
Interview Questions: Why did you apply here

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Phone screen, brief, directly with peer  - brief. I felt like the interviewer made decision within two minutes of talking to me. Didn’t hear back until position closed several weeks later.
Interview Questions: Why I wanted to leave - it seemed like a step back ? Current job title was “higher” than position I was interviewing for

title: Student Ambassador Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very straight forward. It was generally more of a friendly chat than anything else. Loved the people and the environment! The Managers were also very kind and always will to work with you and your schedule!
Interview Questions: Why do you want this position?

title: Cafeteria Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process for joining the dining staff as a student was very straightforward. It was mostly a matter of filling out paperwork, determining schedule, etc. It was very easy to get the job.
Interview Questions: What hours can you work?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: 1 phone call, then 2 in-person interviews. I met with different people for each interview, both of whom had similar questions. Everyone was very nice during the interview. It took some time to get back to me via email, but that's to be expected.
Interview Questions: Can you handle several tasks at once?

title: Recruitment Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: There was a first-round 30-minute phone interview, that consisted of more open ended questions. Then the second-round interview was an in-person interview with more of the department team and leadership team. The second round had more behavioral-based questions that were asked.
Interview Questions: What does Diversity Equity and Inclusion mean to you?

title: Travel and Expense Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI)
Interview Descriptions: A little intimidating, 3 people in one room with 3-4 pages of behavioral questions. I swear I answered like 18 questions. All "name a scenario where you did X or Y"
Interview Questions: What was a challenge you overcame?

title: Prospect Research Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Submitted online application, then the office got back to me for a round of interviews. The interviews were all in person, first talked to the HR person and then team members.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: I applied to the job online through the Michigan Jobs portal. It took a while for me to hear back, probably over a month. After one interview it took less than two weeks to get notification of my job offer
Interview Questions: What experience do you have?

title: Student Admissions Office Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: I applied via the University Careers portal. I applied through the work study program, and they were very accommodating of my hours available. Interviewed me as a freshman, and asked for a resume online.
Interview Questions: How comfortable are you answering the phones and responding to emails?

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Dearborn, MI) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: There wasn't really an interview; once you get a professor who is doing research to notice you and show your skills in his class you will get the offer through him.
Interview Questions: Are you a US citizen?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: Short phone interview after an online application. After the phone interview, I was invited to the office to discuss the position with two employees. The interview was all behavioral-type questions.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you overcame conflict with a team.

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: The director first set up a zoom meeting with me and her project coordinator. I was then invited for a campus visit where I presented my research, met with several of the admin folks and other researchers/professors.
Interview Questions: Were related to my research, theoretical approaches, and management.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Tough  but it was interesting if you able to develop your capacity at a short time you have the oppotunity in this university located at MiI in dearborn but you need to be strong to be able  to work in this establishment though
Interview Questions: Describe any project you have done before

title: PSA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: 2 interviews, basic questions. Meet with a manager and director. Then meet with office staff. Be aware of how the office staff acts with director and manager. It would be a red flag.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work in this department

title: ITS Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: It was a very good experience, and the employees were very interested in seeing how much I was willing to learn. They had a quick technical question based on the department I applied to.
Interview Questions: Depends on the department

title: Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Contact the professor or the lab directly. It’s not difficult if you’re a student at Univeraity of Michigan . Highlight your research experience and skills on your resume and during he interview.
Interview Questions: Research experience

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Did one in person interview. It was pretty simple and typical of what one would expect from a research position interview. They showed the lab and what some of the researchers were currently working on
Interview Questions: Why I decided the major I choose.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: It was a Skype interview because I was not in the country, but an offer was already made when I was interviewing. My supervisor asked me about my previous relevant experience, introduced his experiences and the group members.
Interview Questions: Asked about one project on CV, and whether I knew the general approach my supervisor is working on.

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: the interview process was fairly straightforward. two rounds of interviews, first one being a phone interview and second was in person. asked fairly easy questions. the hiring process took about a month and a half
Interview Questions: strengths and weaknesses

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Michigan in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was good. It was easy. If I remember correctly,  mostly research work questions were asked. it was fairly easy and mainly focused on my projects plus a few behavioural questions.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with a conflict

title: Content Strategist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: Four rounds, two in person. Enjoyed the in person as able to see the offices. Interviewed with skip manager as well as direct manager. Was able to interview with a variety of people in different departments.
Interview Questions: What is something interesting about you that's not on your resume?

title: BI Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Michigan in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was quite simple. It was a 2 step interview process. The technical round had questions about your resume and some technical questions. Then was a behavioral round
Interview Questions:
Tell me your experience with SQL. 
Database management experience

title: Applications Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan in Jan 2019
