Interview Descriptions: Process was simple. All the questions asked were behavioral and how we relate it to the previous experience. Good guidance from hiring manager.I applied in November last year, got a call in January. Process took 2 weeks from then and 3 weeks to give out the result.
Interview Questions: Did you face a situation where you did not agree with the other team member.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: They asked me about my previous experience and why I wanted to work for them despite my not having any relative classes nor experience in the contents of their library.
Interview Questions: Why should we consider you?

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Research those interviewing you! Contact people via email before the email and try to network. Additionally, prepare to discuss thoughts regarding future research streams. Be sure to tailor your information to those you want to work with over the course of your degree.
Interview Questions: What was the most difficult piece of writing you've ever worked on?

title: Research Technician Intermediate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI)
Interview Descriptions: Invited to interview about an week after submitting the application. Interviewed by PI and meet the lab afterwards. The interview was quick and got asked about general lab experience and work personality. Offered the position 2 weeks after the interview.
Interview Questions: What was your previous research project about?

title: Guest Service Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and then had a video interview.  Next I received a call for a face to face interview.  I was interviewed by 2 people.  The interview was relaxed with standard interview questions.
Interview Questions: Explain your resume, previous employers, job titles, dates of employment.

title: Cashier Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: it was very chill they were mostly behavioral questions and things were definitely really chill. They were very exact in what they wanted to know and they knew what kind of questions they wanted to ask. You can pause before you answer which i advise because you need to think before you answer.
Interview Questions: They asked me what I would do if I ran out of cash in the cashier machine

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview for the general resident assistant position was facilitated by 2 Housing Directors per interviewee. They asked a lot of behavioral questions and hypothetical questions to assess the interviewee's responses.
Interview Questions: Name a time when you were an ally for someone?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Simply want to know why you applied and what you can bring to the classroom. How will you go about helping students and ensuring their success in the classroom. I applied and was given a quick interview that assessed my teaching abilities. I then met the professor I was going to work with and got the chance to know her and her teaching style and collaborated with create workshop plans for evening workshops.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this position?

title: Call Center Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Two interviews one over phone and one in person. The questions focused on customer experience and problem solving resolution. Over the phone was mostly just to gauge your personality. The in person was more intense.
Interview Questions: If you had an issue with a colleague, what would you do to resolve it?

title: SERVICE ADVISOR Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Calm non threatening interview.  Went in front of a panel of 3 academic folks amd they each had 5 questions they wanted to ask. After that was done, i was asked to sit at front desk akd answer some email questions as if i were sending to a student
Interview Questions: How does your previous work experience qualify you for this position

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: So far it has been wonderful. everyone ive spoken to so far has explained everything about the hiring process very clearly, they were cheerful and friendly and reassuring. They complimented me about being in school and furthering my education and even complimented my resume and how well written it is.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time that you went above and beyond in patient care

title: Communications and Public Relations Strategist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online. Was contacted to arrange initial phone interview with hiring manager and HR rep. After that had series of BlieJeans (Skype) interviews with lots of people.

Received good responses to thank-you notes.

Three weeks later, received an automated rejection email. It was a bummer to receive the automated rejection after engaging personally with so many people, but I guess that’s the process.
Interview Questions: What’s a challenge you had, how did you deal with it and what did you learn?

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Michigan in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: As i was abroad, so i was contacted through email, then my interviews were conducted online. First one was with a panel, then a 1-1 and a final with another panel.
Interview Questions: Past research and future plans

title: Patient Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: In person.  Questions were behavioral based and scenarios with CER answers. Pretty standard interview, almost scripted. Pretty easy to nail just be "pro-blue" and act like you really want to be there.  Also, helps if you want to further your education and act interested in advancing.
Interview Questions: Behavioral questions.

title: Law Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: casual interview, but they are looking for enthusiasm and attention to detail. You need to be prepared and know what kind of work they do and what you want to do with them
Interview Questions: What kind of work do you want to do here

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and received an email shortly after for a phone interview. Completed the phone interview, which was about 5 minutes long, and received my offer a few days later.
Interview Questions: How would you handle an unsatisfied caller?

title: Public Relations Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Michigan in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: Had a phone interview with two managers. One was quite friendly and seemed receptive; the other was abrupt and clearly had no sincere interest in hearing my responses. Unfortunately, it was also rather obvious that he was in charge and that the other hiring manager was deferential to him.
Interview Questions: If you could write a story about anything, what would it be?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: It was short interview mostly to gauge the motivation behind applying and understanding the career path for future. They also talked about my field interest. The interview happened after going through a data test.
Interview Questions: What do you intend to gain from this position?

title: Academic Auditor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with head of the department.  She was very pleasant and easy to talk to.  Very knowledgeable.  It was made clear that I was not who they were looking for.   She was very nice about it though.
Interview Questions: How long would you plan on working at this job?

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Michigan in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: Two hour Zoom call with the PI (principal investigator) of the grant funding the position, a social scientist in the engineering school, followed by an awkward phone (non-video) call with a HR representative the following day. The Zoom call focused on research ideas and almost felt like a collaboration session with a lot of positive energy, whereas the HR call consisted of more typical interview questions. I was under the impression that the HR rep was using a script and trying to do a standardized evaluation of all candidates.
Interview Questions:
PI: Oh, so that's interesting. What are some other funders we could pursue for this sort of grant proposal?
HR: Tell me about a time you overcame a conflict with a co-worker.

title: Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: In the 1st round interview, I was asked to record my answers to the interview questions through an online portal and email my questions about the job to the hiring manager. There was no direct interaction in the interview process. I didn't pass the 1st round.
Interview Questions: Introduce yourself in 90 seconds.

title: Peer Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Very friendly interviewers on the phone. There was a quick turnaround with offer. In addition, the interview was very informative and  I learned a lot about the position from it.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have working in a team

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI)
Interview Descriptions: Applied through umbrella program for research.  Flew out for interview with 5 faculty.  Interview sessions included lunch and dinner with students and faculty.  Interviews were 1:1, where they asked questions about your research interests, career aspirations, and goals.  Also met with several departments at a poster session.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to go into research?

title: Business Systems Analysis & Support Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions:
I interviewed on the phone for a position at The University of Michigan Law School's Information Technology department. The title of the position was "Business Systems Analysis & Support Analyst." I'm not making this up. The interviewers were beyond rude and maybe even laughed at one of my answers. They were unprofessional. Their behavior makes a bad impression on the university. I hope their superiors at the university are reading this review. 

I'm glad I didn't get an offer from the university for this position because I wound up getting an offer from a company that was about $10,000 per year more than the starting salary for this position. 

Good luck if you work with these people.
Interview Questions: What is your favorite function in Excel?

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: First round was an in-person interview with the H.R. hiring manager and position supervisor, followed by a later round of interviews with faculty and staff I would work with. They were looking for someone to shadow the current employee so the process went faster than usual, I think.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you wish you had handled something differently

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: A professor sent an email to all of the students in our major and i reply to him soon. He had an interview with me soon and he was satisfied with my resume and just made sure if i could write c++. Then i was admitted.
Interview Questions: show me your c++ project

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: When there is a job opening, apply through the system.  Then, you will have an interview with the PI.  Generally, they are trying to find someone with the skills they need.  It won't not hard if you are qualified.
Interview Questions: Introduction.  What skills you have?

title: Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Detroit, MI) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: I had a skype call, then HR call, and onsite interview. Everything smooth. But i did not understand why i was accepted. By the way, the only reason i refused was due to the quality of teaching over there.
Interview Questions: Background

title: Emergency Management Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: I completed a one-way video interview via Spark Hire in which I answered 6 questions.  My answers were timed based on the complexity of the question.  I submitted the videos, and after two weeks followed up with the point-of-contact from HR regarding the possibility of an in-person interview.  I was informed that the selection committee still had not viewed the videos, but was encouraged to follow up two weeks later.  I then followed up two weeks later and received no response.  I found out from an acquaintance that works in this department that I was likely not selected for the position (or an in-person interview), which is why no one contacted me or responded to my inquiries.  This was nearly 1 month after submitting my video answers.
Interview Questions: Describe a preparedness activity you participated in, and what was the most satisfying aspect of that activity?

title: PDF Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Anna, OH) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions:
The interview is based on your knowledge and presentation skills.
It is a very productive environment like an enterprise where multiple minds and brains meet.  Awesome working environment with many challenges and fun. WIll definitely uplift the caliber of the employees.
Interview Questions: About my commitment

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: I am interviewed by my advisor. And he asked me about some technical questions about my research field. And also he challenged me to think about some experiment design.
Interview Questions: The question is limited to the research field, no reference value.

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: It takes FOREVER.. I have been jumping through hoops every week for the past 4 weeks. Each week I get an e-mail with something else to do. I wish I could do everything at once instead of heading there over and over to pay for parking each time.
Interview Questions: Do you match the required job requirements?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: the interview process was not bad.  basic skills regarding research lab techniques were asked. such as how to perfomrm certain lab procedures - pcr, western blots. it is usually the graduate student or phd student interviewing you and most labs you don't see your PI- the head of the lab.
Interview Questions: how to do western blots, PCR etc.

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: I had already worked there for two years in a different role and was offered this position. Wasn't much of an interview process. A lot of people are hired in from other positions because the ladder of progression is so slow so people tend to jump to different jobs in order to make more money.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Administrative Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: easy, I am a temp so the interview was very easy and they didnt really ask much. When i interviewed for the reg position, it was very intense. It was one on one and just went through my resume.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Security Guard Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview was on way vedio interview. There were plenty of time to read the questions and recording the answer and change it if you want to. They let you prepare few day before and they give you some practice questions before you start the actual interview.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your background experience and education as it appears on your resume.

title: Research Laboratory Technician Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: I had an hour long interview with the PI. Next was a 30 minute interview the lab staff I would be working with (4 people total). Finally, I was shown the basics of what I would be doing for this specific job position.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself? Do you have any work related research experience? If no, why not (was it not provided at your college, are you fresh out of college, etc)? Strengths? Weaknesses? Give an example of a time you weren't able to complete a project on time and what could you have changed to meet that deadline? Give an example of a time you work on group project? What do you like least and most about working in a lab? Do you work well with others? Name specific lab techniques and equipment you are familiar with.

title: Web Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Richmond, VA) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: it was very easy to get through the interview process. they were helpful and welcoming and I felt that i wanted to join as soon as I walked in the door. I do not regret this experiance in the keast
Interview Questions: What do you want to offer the company

title: Development Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Once you apply online, you will hear back in a week or so about whether you receive an interview and choose a time slot from a link they send you. At the interview, all the candidates from that round will be sitting in a waiting area with two D-SIP alumni checking them in and answering questions. Half will be taken into the group interview, and half go into one on ones. For the group interview, they give you a short reading assignment beforehand (at the time of interview offer email) and you simply discuss it with one of the internship coordinators prompting questions. The one on one is pretty informal, it's more having a conversation so they can gauge what unit would be the best fit for you.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have in philanthropy and fundraising?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: U of M is highly competitive and interview process is Rigorous. Not for the faint of heart.  There is a large group of brilliant people all vying for the same position.  Get ready for the Politics.  It’s WHO you know and are connected to as much as what you know.  Don’t think you are the sharpest pencil in the box.   The brightest and best work here.   It can leave one feeling very marginalized and invisible.
Interview Questions: What can you offer and/or contribute?

title: Patient Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI)
Interview Descriptions: Apply online @ www.umjobs.org. If you have not taken their "tests" which include: written, logic, basic math test, then HR will require you to do so before applying. Once applied and if they call, they usually request a phone interview before in person.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Business Development Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Many positions at the University of Michigan already have a candidate selected when the posting is listed. I was one of these candidates, where I had already worked in the position on a contract basis, and then the position was turned into full-time position because I was successful in the contract role.
Interview Questions: What brings me joy?

title: Communications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Overall positive process. I first had a phone interview for roughly 30 minutes. They then followed up with several case studies I had 2 weeks to complete. They were slow getting back with me and actually didn't respond for several weeks. I had to follow up several times in order to receive a response.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in the future?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Director introduces the program and talked about future research interest. A relaxed style just asked about the experience and what kind of lifestyle you would like. As an international student, it was a skype meeting. It is more like a chat not a test.
Interview Questions: Do you have any specific professor you want to work with

title: Clinical Monitor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Was cold called by the hiring manager; typically not an issue but it should have warned me of what was to come. I have done many interviews with many companies but never had one so unprofessional. Before the call was done, I actually asked to be removed from consideration for the position. Being a Michigan native, I have the greatest respect for the University and U of M healthcare but I don't think I would ever apply there again.
Interview Questions: Describe how your experience will be helpful in this position.

title: Degree Audit Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: They simply invited me to interview with them face-to-face. I thought I did very well in the interview, but I could never get an answer to two follow-up emails I sent after the interview.
Interview Questions: They just ask questions directly related to the scope of the position. However, it will be different for every job you apply for knowing how decentralized they are.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: Group interview with manager and three other admin assistants. Laid back interview in order to gauge personalities. I was hired 10 minutes after the interview- the manager called me to offer me the job
Interview Questions: What work environment do you thrive in?

title: Development Seasonal Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: Submission of resume and enter yourself into the application online system, the interview with department manager. Submission of resume and enter yourself into the application online system, the interview with department manager.
Interview Questions: Are you familiar with Microsoft Office?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was a total of about 2.5 hours starting with lunch with director, then a tour of school, and 2 more interviews with other team members. You have to find your own way there.
Interview Questions: What are your questions on the position?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: There is no interview for graduate student. We interview the university. Very young faculty makes it easier to publish which is the dream of every graduate student. Michigan helps us do that without problem.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: I emailed the professor that I was interested in his research and was curious if there were any research positions available on the project. Got an email back asking me to come in for an interview.
Interview Questions: What interests you most about this project?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Phone screening, then a one on one interview with my potential manager, then a third round interview with a higher-up. Definitely seemed like a competitive process for an administrative assistant role, but I guess I get it, seeing as it is Michigan. I made it to the final round but was not offered the position.
Interview Questions: Describe a time that  you have failed, and what happened.

title: Teacher Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was efficient, comfortable and straightforward. Clear guidelines and relevant questions, good communication throughout. University of Michigan excels at making sure everyone is on the same page. The background check and other relevant paperwork were easy to fill out.
Interview Questions: How I would/could handle specific issues in a pre-k classroom?

title: Health and Wellness Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Professional, but easy going. Authentic and straight forward. Very well managed. Email, calls, and texts were easily understandable. Process was conducted efficiently. No what ifs? Or leading you on. Very informative also.
Interview Questions: Goals, background, job related instances

title: Sr Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Met with multiple people from the department I would be working in, including my direct supervisor and program heads. Pretty standard process, with questions both specific to the position and more general work style and ethic. Formal but pleasant.
Interview Questions: How do you handle multiple conflicting priorities?

title: Senior Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI)
Interview Descriptions: I sent a cold call cover letter based on online research. Then I had multiple phone calls with people in the department and several months of email. Finally, I had an person interview, then a formal application process online and background check.
Interview Questions: Q. How would you pitch our programs to development professionals to bring major gifts to the department?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: Went in for 2 interviews and met all the doctors, got to take a look around the hospital and see where everything is,  sat in a conference room where the interview process took place.
Interview Questions: what would i do in a situation that needed to be be fixed right away

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Phone call first then in person.  Manager and HR person in same interview.  Had to prove I knew excel.  Had to sit at front desk for 30 minutes to observe.
Interview Questions: How do you feel about selling the doctor's  skin line?  Can you do formulas in excel?

title: Admin Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI)
Interview Descriptions: You apply online and await a call/email from the department you applied to. The timeline varies based on how quick the department is. For some positions, I didn't find out that I didn't get the job until two months after the job posting closed. Other positions called me before the position closed.
Interview Questions: Basic questions for an interview. It really depends on the department.

title: AV Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: Took a long time to get back to me.  Email you and arrange a time with not a lot of prep time.  They asked a lot of typical personality questions
Interview Questions: Do you have 35mm experience

title: Communications Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions:
Positive: I was contacted for an in-person panel interview via email. All communication before and after was very professional (e.g. I was told exactly how the interview would go, about next steps, and informed that I had not been chosen for the position). The interview itself was held in a conference room in one of the departments I would have been working for (had I been hired). 
Negative: Although behavioral questions are typically asked in interviews, this interview ONLY consisted of behavioral questions. No questions or discussion directly about the position (until it was my turn to ask questions). Also, my lack of "full-time employment" history was called into question. (FYI: I was the most educated person in the room and, although I do have work experience, I have been unable to work full-time because I have been a full-time student until now). Additionally, at the end of the interview, when we were all shaking hands, I realized that one of the interviewers was only wearing socks! Normally, this wouldn't have offended me, but since I had traveled a long distance to be there and was dressed professionally, it was rather upsetting to see that one of the interviewers hadn't even bothered to bring shoes into the room!
Interview Questions: 6 pages worth of behavioral questions (literally every behavioral question you can possibly think of... and more)

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Very relaxed. Wanted to know about my past experience and what I could bring to the team. Other than the interview, there is a drug test (urine) for employees working at the health system. Overall process took about 3 weeks.
Interview Questions: What do you want to do after graduation?

title: Communications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: I was first called by an Admin Asst. to schedule a phone interview with the hiring manager.  This was very nice for a few reasons, it allowed me to prepare for the phone interview, unlike a lot of places that just call you out of the blue. The other reason this was nice was because I was to be speaking directly with the hiring manager for a more thorough phone interview, as opposed to a recruiter.  The phone interview was a lot of basic interview questions and I also asked a lot myself. After a few weeks I heard back and was reached out to by the admin asst. to schedule an in person interview. The in-person was over an hour and a half and I met with different team members as well as the hiring manager. I heard back the next day that I did not get the position. Overall it was a very good experience.
Interview Questions: Most difficult questions were specific situational ones: How would you handle this specific situation. While the questions were totally appropriate,  they are just hard to think of in an already nerve-racking situation.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI)
Interview Descriptions: Applied through the Undergraduate Research Opportunity Program and got matched with potential Principal Investigators. Emailed to set up interviews and got lab tours and met with staff and graduate students.
Interview Questions: What do you hope to gain from research experience?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Applied a week ago and received a phone call went in, was told to dress casual cute, got there was asked to pick a going out outfit and an outfit for an interview! Super great nice people
Interview Questions: Tell me something about your research interest

title: Graduate Student Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: You have to get up and explain some concept relevant to the class you will be teaching to demonstrate that you understand the concept and can effectively speak in front of a group
Interview Questions: How would you explain *some specific topic* to a student

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: I just met with the professor who needed help and discussed whether I could handle the work I would be doing.  It was very informal and I was told I had the job within 5 minutes.
Interview Questions: I was asked if I was familiar with what I would be doing.

title: Residential Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Speak with Hall Directors maybe one or two and it's about 30 min long. Behavioral questions and situational to hear how you would handle situations. They also want to hear about your background to judge whether you'd be a good candidate and of course be ready to explain why you and interested in the position
Interview Questions: Experience with diversity

title: Athletics Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by three coaches and was asked very routine questions about myself. They were all very respectful and provided great insight about the job. Interview was very straightforward and overall a positive experience.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was between the Private investigator and I in his office.  It was very relaxed and not pressured at all. There was a series of questions asked and I answered. that was pretty much it.
Interview Questions:
What is your experience?
What about this job attracted you?
Are you familiar with any of our lab techniques?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: They asked a pre selected set of questions which were very behavioral type. Only 2-3 other technical questions were asked. They give a lot of importance to cover letter in the application which is generally the first page of resume, take your time to draft it well.
Interview Questions: Did you write automated tests in your previous job.

title: Computer Consultant II Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview was great and personalized. It was more about me and my accomplishments than any technicalities. They really wanted to know who I was as a person over the kind of work I've done; if I was a good fit for the team over any sort of objective principle, since most of the skills could be learned as long as the basic threshold had been met.
Interview Questions: What Projects Have You Worked On With Code?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: One phone interview and that was it. Other students got to visit the campus, but I was in China. They apparently don't invite International students for a campus visit. I still got the offer later, though.
Interview Questions: mostly about my experience and school

title: Student Dining Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Detroit, MI) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Very easy. No actual interview. You just sign up for a meeting and full out papers for payroll. A decent job but little pay. The staff are nice and you can meet new people. Good for freshman students but they do have a high turnover rate so do not plan to work very long unless you want to try to get a promotion.
Interview Questions: Have you worked anywhere before?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Michigan (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: They brought people in.  We talked about the program.  There was food, we met current students.  Everything was ok overall.  I'm here now, so there's that too.
Interview Questions: What do you want

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Started off with a phone screening with 2 people, next was an in-person interview with the same 2 people which was the Cheif administrator and executive interim secretary. After that about 3 days later they did a reference check. Same day scheduled a meet and greet with staff and director in the morning and then by the afternoon I got a call with a phone offer then an email with official offer
Interview Questions:
How do you deal with confidentiality?
Tell me about a time where you had multiple projects? How were you able to meet deadlines?
What type of support do you feel the Executive assistant should give the Chief Administrator?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: 2 rounds to narrow down 50 applicants to 2  recipients. One online questionnare and one face to face interview with the professor hiring for the job. The interview was in the office of the prof, very laid back
Interview Questions: Why do you want to do research?

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Dearborn, MI) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Multiple multi-panel interviews as well as one on ones with leadership.  The interviews took place over a few weeks. They seemed to have a bad experience with a previous employee so the questions were geared toward how I would handle a situation where there was a financial discrepancies, gossipy co-workers, and dealing with mundane tasks. They would ask a few questions regarding my skills but most of it would revolve around specific behaviors. It was odd to have to answer to questions about situations that I had never really found myself in because I have a good work ethic or there are already checks and balances in place to prevent them.  They also insisted on speaking to a current supervisor as a reference even though I had let them know it would compromise my current job.
Interview Questions: What was my favorite Excel formula?

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very short, most of the question are technical related to projects and lab techniques. Job description did not match the requirements she was asking for while interviewing, I did answered all of them. There is no reply after the interview for feedback even after several followup emails, which I felt was not professional.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself 5 years from now?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: I got referred to my PI by another PI.  Therefore, I did not have to go through HR interview.  My PI is very nice and the question is mainly about my specialty.  I got to present about my work in front of the lab members.
Interview Questions: Describe the type of research you did

title: Field Interviewer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: The interview was pretty straightforward. I performed mock interview on both computer and paper. Afterwards there are some behavioral questions. They also gave me more details regarding the project I would be working on if I got hired. The interviewers were very professional.
Interview Questions: What would you do if you cannot finish a project on time?

title: Research Position Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview first. Onsite Interview goes as arranged. got a schedule before interview , all procedure described . Friendly and open discussion of background and interest. Lab tour after interview. Campus is beautiful.
Interview Questions: How long do you plan to work?

title: Grader Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: Conctacthe faculty member is the first step. Then interview with faculty member and talk about your background like what course you've already had and what's your grade for that.  Claiming you're pursue a phd in relavent are is very helpful.
Interview Questions: academic background

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: Initially, a telephone interview...I missed that email, so the hiring manager was fine with my advancing to the next level and covering the information there.  That was cool of her.  So the next interview was with three people.  I did not expect that.  A significant amount of time was spent in their telling me about advancement opportunities...none of this "we expect you to commit to this position for two years" stuff.  Wonderful.  They gave me realistic expectations of the job and were very comfortable to talk to, not at all high pressure.  Next step was with faculty.  They, too were low key and welcoming.  I did not get the first position, but where I landed is actually a better fit where I can really use my talent and "get out of my lane" to enhance my role and make it far more interesting.  No one is threatened by that, in fact, they love it!  There is not stifling talent at UM.  Go blue!
Interview Questions: Will this job be enough for you?  (I was returning to work after years away so coming in at a lower level than when I left my career,)

title: Graphic Design– University Musical Society (Umich Work-study Position) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: I responded to a job posting online via a student job opportunities blog. Emailed resume and cover letter. Received email back asking for work samples. Came in for in-person interview.
Interview Questions: Why I would be a good fit for the job

title: Audiovisual Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was seated in a small conference room with about 5 managers/supervisors where they asked me questions and wrote down the answers. After, I went on a tour of some of the facilities where I'd be working.
Interview Questions: How did you deal with a difficult interaction at another job?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Dearborn, MI) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: You have to mail the professor showcasing your interest and talent. If the professor likes your profile he will set up an interview wherein you will be tested on technical grounds and on your previous knowledge and contributions in the respective field
Interview Questions: You knowledge and contribution to their field and describe it breifly

title: Postdoctoral Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at University of Michigan in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was hired for this post-doc position via an interview over the phone (no on-site interview). The phone conversation was semi-casual, and consisted of me giving an overview of my background, and the PI describing the project and the required skills.
Interview Questions: I was asked why I was interested in this particular project at post-doc level.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Michigan in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: There were two virtual 30 minute interviews following an online application form. The first interview was via Google Hangouts with the lab manager and another a few days later with the PI via telephone. They were both formal interviews of the job description and my previous experience. I was told of my offer within the next three business days.
Interview Questions: What makes you a good fit for the lab?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Simple and straightforward. Present your credentials and cv and there isn't a problem becoming a member of the faculty. I was very pleased with the interviewer. I am an alumni so that probably had a great deal to do with it as they tend to take care of their own. Go for it if you are an alumni.
Interview Questions: Did you enjoy your time as an undergraduate?

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very professional interview process, which led to meeting the team and having a one on one conversation with all the faculty and students in the lab and then met with the boss individually to discuss his goals and expectations from me
Interview Questions: What is your motivation to join the lab at University of Michigan

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Online submission, 30 minute phone screening interview,  60 minute in-person panel interview which included a tour of the  building, one last 1:1 meeting with supervisor and then they asked for references.
Interview Questions: Case Study Scenario

title: Field Interviewer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Michigan in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Easy over the phone. First interview was for about 30 mins. The second over the phone interview was via Skype and was super easy and last about 30 mins. And the last interview was face to face. And last for about 30 mins.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work as a field Interviewer?

title: Hotel Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Met with student manager and hotel manager. I was asked a series of questions regarding my part experience working at a front desk and working in customer service. The job was described in detail, and I was asked about my availability, as this job is part time for University of Michigan students. I was given a tour of the facility and introduced to the other staff members at the University of Michigan League.
Interview Questions: Describe past customer service experience

title: Stewardship Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions:
First, I'd like to state that I did *not* get this interview as result of a referral. 

I applied remotely, so it ended up being a Skype interview. I met with HR first. Asked a lot of typical questions ("Why U of M?" "Are you prepared to move right away?" "Strengths/weaknesses", etc.). The person I interviewed with seemed very interested in what I had to say and provided a lot of feedback. The interview immediately went into a second with the supervisor for the position I'd applied for. He asked a lot of the same questions, explained a lot about the position, etc. Overall, it was a really good experience. Both interviewers were personable and seemed genuinely interested in me as a candidate. When I ended up getting passed over for an internal candidate, I was sent a very nice email encouraging me to apply to the department again in the future, which I most definitely will do.
Interview Questions: What are your 5 weaknesses/5 strengths?

title: Transit Coach Operator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was contacted about two weeks later in the summer. The application was very simple and not awful. The interview was also not awful, but he asked interesting questions. At the end of the day they want to see that you can keep a level head and think about the safety of passengers.
Interview Questions: Give me your best and worst experience while riding the bus.

title: Student Temp Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Half hour face to face interview with a member of the office that I would be hired in to. They asked me about some of my experiences, solve some simple problems, and put me in a scenario to see how I interact with customers.
Interview Questions: Explain one of your weaknesses.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Was contacted one week after for a phone screen. Phone screen was about 30 minutes long with five participants asking a couple of questions each. The questions were easy but often phrased awkwardly and had to be broken up into smaller segments or repeated in order to be intelligable.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with multiple interruptions?

title: MRI Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Michigan in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Hour long in person interview. They went over my education and history or work places and went over how I felt I could contribute to their team. There was three department heads there. Each one took turns asking questions. Not too stressful
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at UofM?

title: Web Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: I got this interview through a recuiter , 1 st round was with manager and next team members . Its more like get to know yourself type interview then technical. The team members are friendly and easy interview.
Interview Questions: why do you want to join our company?

title: Athletic Department Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Group interview with questions about my experiences, group was very friendly and basically asked how I would handle a variety of scenarios.  Everyone was incredibly friendly.  I went through two rounds of interviews with the department.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: The professors asked me some thing relevant to my research experiences. They proposed me a research project and ask me if I got interested in it. Then, I did some research abut the topic and decided to take the offer.
Interview Questions: What do you think about Linear Parameter Varying system

title: Phlebotomist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: The position has to be posted for one week at least. Interviews occur for the duration of one week. Background check make take up to one week. Training occurs for is 5-6 weeks.
Interview Questions: What is my availibility

title: Research Program Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Met with multiple faculty members and program manager. Went over my prior experience and asked for specific examples. The interview process was 3 hours long.  Providing writing samples.
Interview Questions: Specifics about research project management, asked for examples.

title: Visiting Nurses Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Odd questions rephrased  over and over.  Made the other interviewer roll her eyes.  Interviewer kept reading from a sheet and never made eye contact with me.  It was ackward.
Interview Questions: All so scripted she didn't know the context of what she was reading.  It was amusing because I don't think she heard my response anyway.

title: ECMO Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI)
Interview Descriptions: Team Interview with individuals that would be working side-by-side.  Held in small conference room in department.  Very personable staff that allowed me to ask my own questions about working in the department.
Interview Questions: How did you deal with a situation where you felt you needed to speak up

title: Admissions Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI)
Interview Descriptions: Submitted resume online through a posting on Michigan's job website. Was later invited for an on-site interview, which included a 10-minute presentation on a topic of my choosing related to the university. I was offered a position by the end of that week.
Interview Questions: How do you respond to criticism?

title: Director of Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: A huge room with 10+ people interviewing me all at once it was very intimidating.  No other interview process at all which was a bit odd.  They didn't seem to be skilled interviewers just a bunch of managers..questions were all over the place
Interview Questions: general

title: Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Standard application requiring a CV and cover letter outlining research interests, alignment with post-doc and plan for post-doc year. Contacted two weeks after my application was submitted via email by the coordinator. Met with the co-directors of the program.
Interview Questions: Met with the co-directors of the program. Asked standard questions about research plan for post-doc year, short- and long term plans and alignment with desired mentor.

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Michigan in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: it was not very hard process, it depends on your resume, grades, recommendation letters, and your statement of purpose. The most important thing is research papers and interests. Make sure that you mention the professor that you want to work with.
Interview Questions: research area?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Michigan in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions:
I met my current professor and we discussed the project and career perspectives.

We also went through my Ph.D. experience, and I have been asked to bring new ideas about the project that I was supposed to work on.
Interview Questions: Experiences and career perspectives

title: Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI)
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was called to schedule a phone interview. The phone interview lasted about 30 minutes and included behavioral questions and specific technical questions. The interviewers went around a table asking questions from a list, so it was fairly rigid and did not include natural conversation. For this reason, I felt it went poorly, but this was actually just the format. The second interview was in person and about a week later--they flew me to campus for an in person interview which was very similar. I was offered the job a couple weeks after that and accepted. The whole process took less than 6 weeks.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Intermittent Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: I walked in, was introduced to everyone, took a seat, and it proceeded to be more like a conversation than an interview. I described myself and my work experience, answered some of their questions, asked some questions of my own, and before I knew it it was over. I left feeling a bit confused--was that really an interview? It was fun.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for us? What experience do you have?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI)
Interview Descriptions: Easy non-threatening process, interviews were short with standard interviews questions. I found out about my offer very soon after my in-person interview. There was only one in-person interview which followed soon after my phone screener.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you faced a challenge.

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Michigan in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Whiteboard interview that took place on north campus. Was an awkward location but the interviewer was nice and we shared a cup of coffee before proceeding. I had a very lovely time in all honesty.
Interview Questions: Bit-fiddling questions.

title: Grader Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Dearborn, MI) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: it went ok.  i was called to attend the interview on afternoon. question were technical and asked mostly about my projects and the experience.  not so stressful easy interview got the position it was good working.
Interview Questions: what is most challenging aspect in your project?

title: Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Very positive, Friendly atmosphere and supportive attitude. Human Resource personnel were cooperative. Hiring process smooth. I moved from another state and I got help from my employer during relocation. Orientation process was well covered to help new personnel to know about the facilities offered by the University
Interview Questions: Goal for next five years

title: Research Lab Specialist Intermediate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was two phone interviews in total. I was asked about my experience, future goals and willingness to work in an academic setting. I also asked to come to the lab and meet the people there before moving on to the next interview step. It helped me understand their research work better.
Interview Questions: willingness to learn more

title: User Interface Design Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Michigan in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very structured and brusk - I felt rushed to answer the questions.  Many people on the phone for the interview.  Wasn't given a good sense of their environment before questions were asked of me.  Few questions about my background and experience.  I had prepared to discuss how my experience relates to the job, based on the job description.
Interview Questions: Favorite and least favorite website or application.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: I submitted an internship application via online interest form/job board website. I was then contacted by the hiring manager for an in-person interview with her. The interview lasted roughly an hour and also included a tour of the facilities and introductions to other staff members the inter would be collaborating and working with. I was then offered internship position shortly after.
Interview Questions: How can you contribute?

title: Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was the following: (1) gave a 30 minute short talk about previous research experience; (2) met individually with several graduate students, postdocs and faculty; (3) had lunch with lab; (4) met with potential employer to discuss specifics about the research project.
Interview Questions: What project do you want to work on?

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: It's intensive and most positions for academic staff take a similar approach. You do a phone interview, then an in-person interview. The in-person interview was 4 hours and I met with 4 different groups of people. It was exhausting.
Interview Questions:
What is your advising philosophy?
Give an example where you've advocated for diversity and inclusion for students.
There were several role-playing scenarios as well.

title: Biochemistry Laboratory Research Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: One telephoning interview and another face to face interview. Here I was asked about recombinant DNA technology, proteins. I was also asked the number of epitope tags I knew about. Off course personal questions were asked.
Interview Questions: Have worked with His-tag?

title: OS Programmer Senior Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Two round interview:
First was Question and Answer Session with several staff members. This lasted about an hour and a half and was encouraged to ask question towards the end.

Second was a meeting with Managers and Upper Management
Interview Questions: Questions ranged from general linux knowledge to open ended questions on architecture design and general 'devops' best practices

title: Web Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: Found out about the position through an online posting and contacted the relevant person with my resume. We made contact and set up a formal interview. A few days after that, I was hired.
Interview Questions: How would you change the design of this interface?

title: Graduate Student Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions:
I applied, they gave me an offer. I visited. I didn't get interviewed to get in at all. 
The visit weekend is very nice and seemingly lavish. They put you in a hotel from Thursday night all the way through Sunday morning. They pay for your flight for the visit. There's a lot of discovering the faculty during this time so that you can mull over or contact a faculty adviser before you enroll. Each department differs in their process of how grad students get assigned or chosen thesis advisers.
Interview Questions: What area of research are you interested in?

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: The interview includes phone call. It really depends on whom you are interviewing for. And it varies from professor to professor. I have had excellent experience. The phone call included talking to the advisor on the phone and describing the projects that you are currently involved and have done previously.
Interview Questions: Describe the projects.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: I received a call from the department for a 30 minute phone interview. I was invited for a face to face interview two days later. They were in a bind to get someone hired immediately. I was flexible and started work when they needed me. I hit the floor running once I arrived.
Interview Questions: How do I handle office chit-chat and gossip.

title: Research Area Specialist Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI)
Interview Descriptions: After a phone interview lasting 20 or 30 minutes, I was invited in for individual interviews with various team members over a few days based on their availability. Different members asked very different questions, but they were all really interesting to talk to, and I actually enjoyed the interview process a lot.
Interview Questions: What did you like most about your last/current job, and what did you like least?

title: Research Technician Intermediate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Typical interview questions. Some questions regarding the actually position, such as what would I do if I finished my work early? Can I use tools? etc.. They also asked the usual interview questions about managing stress, managing an issue with a coworker, issues with a supervisor, etc.
Interview Questions: What would I do if I am scheduled to travel to a location, but there is a snowstorm.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: A month after submitting my CV I have an email to set up an interview by Skype. After a few days I have another email that I have accepted for the position.
Interview Questions: It was about my research papers and projects

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Pretty standard interview, nothing too technical. We went over my resume with the person I would be researching under. Asked what i would want to get out of the position, etc.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in research looking to improve the psychosocial protocals for cancer patients?

title: Building Supervisor- Rec Sports Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: It was a few years back but over all it is pretty simple-- should be no probem especially if you have been practicing mock interviews/ interviewing for actual internships/job outside of work study campus jobs.  Questions will range from general to sceanrios you could encounter at the facility.  Basically checking for common sense.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was straight-forward. Interviewer was kind and tried to make it an comfortable environment, which I really appreciated. Also, I was asked some specific questions regarding the research position that I was applying for, not so much to test my knowledge, but to gauge my interest in the area of research. I also met the the current research assistant to see if we were a good match.
Interview Questions: How do you think you may be most helpful in this position?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: They just showed me around the lab and told me what I would be doing. I met all the workers in the lab. I was then showed how to do a couple of my frequent tasks.
Interview Questions: What are you future career goals?

title: Docent At the Museum of Natural History Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Michigan in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Brittany, the student affairs program manager, will contact you to set up an interview time. The email will also include information on the American Mastodon. You will be asked to take this information and make an interactive five minute presentation. 

When you first get to the interview you will go over your resume and some basic interview questions. Then Brittany will talk about the training and hours required for the job. If you agree that you can provide that level of commitment then you will go upstairs to do your Mastodon presentation. You will be judged on your public speaking skills and the way you engage your audience. Then you can expect to hear back in a week.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at the museum?

title: Research Area Specialist Intermediate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions:
The position I applied was at Kidney Epidemiology Cost Center affiliated to the biostatistics department at School of Public Health. 

SAS Sample code review

Phone interview

On site interview, 4 rounds in total, 2 hours
1. Met the analyst team (up to 7 analysts, led by 1 senior analyst), 30 minutes
2. Met the Manager and co-director with a model interpretation test. They gave me a research question and asked me how would I approach the research question. They also gave me SAS output. 
3. Met  with the Director, 30 minutes
4. Finished a SAS written test, 8 questions, 30 minutes
Interview Questions:
Talk about your research question. 
Why you want to apply a position at KECC?
Why you leave your current job?
Do you have any questions for us?
Explain your sample SAS code to us, etc

title: Academic Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Dearborn, MI) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Pretty straight forward with transcripts of your previous courses taken Although they take along time to get back to you, you will have to bug them to get the position. Also make sure you apply at the beginning of the semester.They usually do not hire for summers.
Interview Questions: Just asked what are the timings your are available to work.

title: Research Area Specialist Intermediate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online and was contacted within a week. First interview was on the phone. As I was living out of state, I made my own travel arrangements for the interview. Day of in-person interview, I met with 4 people from the group (1 PI, 2 program coordinators, 1 admin). I was not given an agenda or schedule of what to expect. I assumed a standard 1 hour interview, since I was not told who I would be meeting with. When I was done meeting with the individuals, I was then instructed to complete a basic skills assessment. The assessment consisted of correcting grammar and formatting a Word document. I was surprised at how menial this task was for the type of position I applied for. Total time taken was 2.5 hours. A few days later, I receive an email asking to arrange 2 more Skype calls. Very flexible of them, but annoying for me. At that time, I had received another job offer and politely withdrew my application.  

This interview was in the Department of Internal Medicine.
Interview Questions: Are you willing to spend a lot of your time on IRB paperwork?

title: Dining Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Brief meeting in manager's office. We talked about my motivations for applying to the cafe as well as my prior experiences in customer services. It was relatively brief and my interviewer didn't talk to me about all of my experiences on my resume nor my major. That didn't deter me from wanting to get the job; it's just a student-job.
Interview Questions: What is your philosophy about customer service?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Dearborn, MI) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: I had e-mailed Professor regarding a research assistantship under him. After a week I heard from him asking for a meeting. I met the professor and he interviewed me and asked me to talk to other people working under him. I spent two weeks to know what kind of research was going under him. after two weeks I was interviewed by professor and the Ph.D. person and got selected.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself? and few material related questions related to position.

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview was conducted by the two directors of the program and involved several parts. I was asked about my prior tutoring experience. I was also asked general interview questions. Questions about my tutoring experience related to any difficult students I had as well as my strategies. I was also asked to do a few teaching demos on subjects I was interested in tutoring. The interviewers also went over workplace policy.
Interview Questions: Did you ever have a difficult student?

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was one business day. It started at 9AM and ended at 4PM or 5PM. The entire day consisted of 3-4 panel interviews with committee, co-workers, and students. It also consisted of a 30 minute presentation in front of the entire Student Affairs Department.
