Interview Questions: Tell me about an experience where you had to facilitate a difficult conversation with students.

title: Laboratory Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Met up at the lab. Immediately began showing me around and describing what my job expectations would be. To be honest it wasn't really an interview because we didn't sit down and discuss anything about my experience or questions or anything traditional like that. The only thing I can think is because I interviewed for a separate job for their spouse they assumed that I was qualified and worthy of the job.
Interview Questions: When can you start working?

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI)
Interview Descriptions: Had two interviews, one with initial supervisor then with the rest of co-workers. The questions were straight forward, very few were behavioral based. The 2nd interview included at least 6 people from the administration.
Interview Questions: Strengths and weaknesses

title: Clinical Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: There were two interviews. First was a group interview (all other clinical social workers) and the second was with someone higher up and was an individual interview. They were both about 45 minutes long. Everyone was very friendly and they all seemed to be close. They also gave you time to ask your own questions. Did not feel rushed at all.
Interview Questions: Case that went well and did not go well? Where do you see yourself in 5 years? What population do you like to work with the most? They will ask you why do you want to work here and to review your past experience. It will be important to have evidence based experience.

title: Wolverine Pathways Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was called in to interview the day before and knew that I had the position upon leaving.  It was on the Ann Arbor campus, and the director was personable and passionate.
Interview Questions: If there were no limitations, what would your ideal school look like?

title: Event Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: I had 2 in-person interviews before hearing the decision, both with different manager-level individuals. They all started with "tell us about who you are" questions, and after they introduce the works in the department, they turn to ability related questions and examples from previous experiences (not limited to work experience).
Interview Questions: As a team member, what can you offer to the center/department?

title: Development Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions:
As a first-round interview, things were pretty relaxed and conversational in nature. It wasn't the normal battery of questions (e.g., "tell me your greatest weakness in the workplace,"). We worked our way through my resume--talked about a few positions and how they related to this one. We talked about the expectations for the position and how the position fit in with the Development infrastructure at the University, etc. 

I didn't make it to the second round, but I wasn't really surprised (I was not terribly qualified for the position).
Interview Questions: Walk me through your resume. Tell me about your past 3 positions and how they relate to the position for which you are applying.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very polite. Warm and friendly personality put me to ease. Many questions were asked, but nothing too difficult. Be prepared to give examples when questions were asked. Overall, interview went well. Definitely wanted the position after the interview
Interview Questions: Tell about a situation when critical thinking was important

title: Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: After applying online, was contacted by a student in the lab. PI of lab asked her grad students to interview candidates for position--a weeding out/first pass before meeting the PI. Not uncommon in academia to have students with little or no HR knowledge, or basic interviewing etiquette.
Interview Questions: How comfortable are you interviewing psychotic people?

title: Library Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was referred by a fellow classmate who worked in the Special Collections library. After putting me in contact with the General Director via email, I went to her office for a brief 1-on-1 interview. The interview was more of a formality than an actual interview and the job itself mostly consisted of just sitting at the front desk. Easy!
Interview Questions: What is your previous work experience?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Was called a few days after applying online. Interview was thorough but friendly. I was interviewed by a panel of people and it lasted apporximately 30 minutes. I provided an additional resume.
Interview Questions: What is something that happened at a previous job that your supervisor was disappointed with

title: Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Detroit, MI)
Interview Descriptions: It was an easy and nice interview. I had to give a presentation of my research work. The questions that I got mostly on research field, and also about the basics of physics, and about the PhD work. Other than that I had meet all lab members and talking about the research field.
Interview Questions: Describe how to design an HEMT

title: Technical Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Only behavioral. They just want to hire nice people. You don't need any technical experience. They will definitely ask you on how to handle tough customer service situations. Just be enthusiastic and honest.
Interview Questions: What kind of consumer technologies do you use on a daily basis?

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by my hiring supervisor and another 4 people who I would be working with directly if I was to be hired. They each took turns asking questions mostly related to customer service and dealing with conflict.
Interview Questions: How do I handle a stress full work environment?

title: Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Applied to online job posting. Called for an interview onsite. Present your research and meet other professors in the project. Meet with the grad students and discuss your research.
Interview Questions: Mainly from your research

title: Senior Business Analyst, UHS Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: After an initial phone screen was brought in for a three-hour in-person interview. Was then given a case study to complete and present in an additional one-hour interview session. Received call from hiring manager stating that someone else was offered the position due to a certification I did not possess (and, incidentally never claimed to possess nor was ever asked about it nor was it specified in the job posting). Additionally, the hiring manager stated that the job was being reposted and that I should not reapply as the repost was a formality in order to hire the other person.
Interview Questions: What steps would you take to manage project X?

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very fast. They asked me to attend the group meeting and present my research. Then they asked questions about my research. They also presented their own research and I was asking questions. They summarized the goals of the project and discussed the future steps.
Interview Questions: research based

title: Communications Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: The first part of the interview I met with the supervisor and had a standard interview. It took approximately 30 minutes. The second part I met with two of my potential co-workers and we asked each other questions, the final part I met with the department head. This was the hardest part of the interview process.
Interview Questions: What is you greatest weakness

title: IT Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Informal, but worthwhile questions were asked. I felt like the questions that I was asked were relevant to the position and not the standard boilerplate time wasting interview questions that most interviewers ask. The interviewers were the people that I would work with, and not HR people, which was nice, and they found positives in my experience that even I didn't know.
Interview Questions: Have you ever dealt with an irate customer?

title: Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Michigan (San Francisco, CA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions:
2 inetrviews process, full day, hectic , 
4 onsite interview and the interviewer was very old couldnt speak
prepare well and also be confident , be prepared well ... also the hr was nice and the day was very sunny
Interview Questions: what is kmeans ?

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Charlotte, NC) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: it was easy, they ask me name three people who will look up for. it took 3 weeks after interview to get the job nhshe ejfnf ksleoef fjrfs help help help nope nope nope
Interview Questions: name three people who will look up for?

title: Administrative Assistant (Part Time) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Four week process with four rounds of interviews. Interviewed by 5 different people. Preliminary telephone screening process, initial interview with primary supervisor, second interview with cross-functional supervisor, third round with two cross-functional team members and department HR representative (all separate interviews). In the end, didn't go with any of the candidates and started process over again (no previous candidates considered).
Interview Questions: Describe a situation where you had to quickly shift focus from one task to another and how did you deal with it?

title: UMHS Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Simple, was asked to come into the hospital and simply had to speak with the head of volunteering for several minutes.  The process was ridiculously easy for me.  Others should be able to do this no problem.  Furthermore, as long as you are personable, can smile, take direction, and give direction, you should be able to get a volunteer position here.
Interview Questions: What was an example of leadership?

title: Customer Relations Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Had a phone interview with manager and group members.  Then was invited for on-site interview with the same group.  Had final interview with upper management.  Interview was mainly about my experience and how would I handle different situations that may arise.
Interview Questions: How do you manage multiple-tasks at once?

title: Statistician Intermediate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: 1. online application by submitting resume and cover letter through the university career website; 2. phone interview with the study manager in the team, 3. on-site face-to-face interview with HR and the study PI, three letters of recommendation was asked by the end of the interview
Interview Questions: Describe your related experience in the past (internship, course projects, etc.)

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: The committee scheduled an interview for the MLA convention after the submission of the initial dossier. The interview was a great experience.  The search committee members were extremely welcoming and professional, and did not have egos despite being extremely prominent figures in their field. The interview lasted nearly an hour and consisted mostly of discussions of my dissertation research.  The questions began very abstractly, as the committee wanted to see how I could think philosophically on my feet and connect my work to broader disciplinary issues. I felt that it was not at all a test of my knowledge or how I would teach, but rather an opportunity to demonstrate how I think critically and engage my field through cutting edge research. They left me much time to ask questions about the program and job, and answered all of them happily and thoroughly.
Interview Questions: No questions were unexpected. It was a discussion of my work and how I could contribute to the program, along with what I would like to teach.

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: It was very pleasant and respectful. I felt very needed here, so I agreed to take the job. All questions were related to the job qualifications, nothing unusual. The travel arrangements were set up perfectly, no delays, very professional approach.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: To find this job, I asked around campus for connections that can provide opportunities for cancer research and I received a contact from the Cancer Center. The PI asked some questions about my experiences and what my GPA was. The process was easy as long as you have a a connection to the cancer center.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have in research?

title: Race Crew Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: it is hard. you have to work hard for it. there are a lot of surprises. you have to know your stuff and willing to learn more. you have to be a patient person and dont get frustrated easily. DONT TOUCH THE ARRAY!!!!.
Interview Questions: why do you want to be come a race crew?

title: Laboratory Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was decent and easy going. I liked how friendly the people were during the interview even though the questions were tough and it was pretty hard to prepare for considering I got informed about the interview only a couple days before the actual event.
Interview Questions: Describe your best experience at a previous job.

title: Student Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: I was emailed by HR and then I set up a meeting with the supervisor. It was a short, 20 minute interview, where the questions were not quite hard. Told me I didn't have an office, but that it would be a flexible job. Asked questions regarding who I was, where I was from, and some more basic questions. Supervisor seemed really interested in my previous experience and towards the end, told me I was perfect for the job and asked what my availability would be like in the future. They hired me immediately after the interview.
Interview Questions: Do you have any statistical analysis experience?

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was brief - primarily focusing on my future career plans and research projects that I was interested in.  Since I was a student here, it was trivial to commence my tenure as a postdoc right after graduation.
Interview Questions: My interest or purpose for pursuing a postdoctoral position.

title: Graduate Student Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Dearborn, MI) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: Easy. All the questions were from the resume. It was 1 on 1 meeting with the hiring professor. questions were asked related to the field of study mine being computer science. It lasted for 30 mins. Needed to work on trail basis and then got the offer.
Interview Questions: Questions related to databases and data mining

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: My interview was with two of the study's coordinators with the school of public health. The process was non-intimidating and very casual. This position was for data collection in hospital sites.
Interview Questions: They asked me to talk about my experiences on my resume in addition to why I wanted the job and why I was a good fit.

title: Graduate Student Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Kind of a long process, as my home department and the department where I teach are different. The interview with the professor took about 30-45 minutes. It mostly consisted of her telling me about the course and then she asked a few questions about me and my experiencing with the subject and with teaching.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Research Lab Tech Intermediate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Very straight forward interview. I sent an email to the lab PI after seeing a posting on an internet listserv. They interviewed me via skype a week later and asked me about my goals and prior experience.
Interview Questions: There really weren't any difficult questions.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Laid back. I was offered the job the same day. They just wanted to make sure they weren't hiring some bum, I suppose. I was interviewed by a team of research staff. The principal investigator was late but was still very impressed with the overall interview and my performance. Although she thought that I lacked experience, she offered me another position in her department. Many former students work for the university as well as individuals in transition. You get a lot of experience that can take you places.
Interview Questions: What are your greatest weaknesses?

title: Writing Tutor/Consultant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: You apply for entry into a year-long training program. If accepted, you spend one semester in the Writing 300 course (about 20 people in my section). Based on your performance there, you may be invited into Writing 301, where the classes consist of mandatory staff meetings (one hour each). The cuts mainly happen at Writing 300.
Interview Questions: Not a question per se, but I got the sense that applicants' thoughtfulness on Writing 300 essays was the main criterion. Most prompts asked us to reflect on the writing process, power dynamics in the university, and things of that nature.

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: Interview for postdoc candidates is as usual. You are asked to give a presentation of your research and then you meet and talk with other professors who will be there in the project and also with the grad students.
Interview Questions: Research presentation and questions from there and also general discussion on the projects etc.

title: Reporting Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: I first got in contact with the department because I knew someone working there. They told me a lot about the company and familiarized me with the lifestyle there. After emailing with the department boss, she told me to apply online and then we set up a date for an interview. After the interview I was offered the position.
Interview Questions: What was something you struggled with in a previous job?

title: Student Building Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was brought in by a team consisting of the building manager and one of the student building managers. They were incredibly nice and super helpful. It was very relaxed and mostly a fit interview. They wanted to make sure I was the right fit for the job and could work with both full time workers and with student employees.
Interview Questions: How did you handle a situation with a person who was not in the correct state of mind.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: nothing special. personality fit. be nice and be polite. don't be a jerk. be humble and be yourself. show that you have flexible schedule and great work ethics. be confident and be patient. one rounds of interview
Interview Questions: do you have leadership experience? what are your special skills? What year are you? what are your previous jobs?

title: Graduate Student Instructor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: No interview, it is part of the work that you have to do being a Graduate Student. You will have  some choice and will be assigned to one depending on demand
Interview Questions: N/A

title: BEC Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Interview was scheduled quickly after applying. The interview was a great opportunity to communicate my skills and abilities as well as understand about expectations. Great interview ettiquette. My interviewer who is also my boss is great and accommodating
Interview Questions: Will you find the job filling?

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: 4 to 5 managers in the interview. quick and painless. afterwards they have you shadow for a half hour to get a feel for the flow of the department
Interview Questions: What is your greatest weakness?

title: Media Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: After submitting my application, I heard back within a few days. There was just a quick behavioral interview. The position was more about fit than anything. They did ask some technical questions about my experience, but nothing unexpected or difficult given the nature of the position. The whole thing lasted less than 45 minutes.
Interview Questions: None, really, very straight forward

title: Bus Driver Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Very behavioral-based. The interviewer takes you to a secluded office and asks you a few basic questions: Why do you want the job? How many hours can you work per week?  What are your strengths? What are some of your weaknesses?
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Development Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: Overall, the process can be summed up by "hurry up and wait!" As with most companies or institutions of this size, there are a lot of boxes that need to be checked and people that need to be involved in the hiring decision. Sometimes their schedules may not be easily aligned and that may require patience as you move through the process though there are often short bursts of a lot of activity and requirements for information from the applicant on short notice.
Interview Questions: There weren't many difficult or unexpected questions, though HR will ask a lot of "tell me about a time when you ... " questions on the spot. You'll need to be prepared to answer as best you can in the moment. Probably an exercise to see how quickly you can think on your feet more than actually getting the best, most accurate answer.

title: Law School Photographer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions:
get into the office
introduce yourself and the work you do
how you will be committed
is your schedule flexible
why law school
what projects you want to work on
talked to two managers
.................................................................
bla bla bla
Interview Questions: your schedule

title: Field Interviewer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at University of Michigan in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied in July and took a typing test that they emailed me. Two months pass and I finally get an email telling me to set up an interview time during the second week of September. The two ladies conducting the interview were great! So nice and personable; they really made me feel at ease. One of the ladies explained the bj to me in greater detail. I just did some assessments on the computer and did a mock interview (that's the main job). Then answered a few questions, some behavior-based and background. Asked a bunch of questions after. They offered me the position when the interview was over.
Interview Questions: How have you dealt with conflict concerning a supervisor or coworker?

title: Academic Support Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Michigan in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: Contacted via email for interview.  Had interviews with 2 managers immediately followed by a group interview with 4 coworkers. Briefly spoke with Administrative Assistant afterward who was not sure if they were doing second interviews.
Interview Questions: How would you relate to College of Engineering students?

title: Media Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: At the Instructional Support Services, the process was very general. At first, it is a very passive aggressive hiring process. You apply online, and usually you don't hear back. Finally, I took initiative to reach out to the hiring manager myself and she scheduled me for an interview. It was an in-person interview focusing on customer service skills. I received the offer the next day.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a poor customer service experience you recently had

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: Sometimes can be a bit much for the level of work you'd be responsible for.  Too many interview rounds almost as if the admin positions are executive levels. Short turn around for when they contact you to interview so be ready.
Interview Questions: What is your strength

title: Part Time Hardware Engineer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Very friendly. I like them. Very easy interview questions as I have taken lots of courses they need. They just went through my resume, and read my project code snippet, and ask some random questions like the availability and how heavy was my course work. They are actually working for UM Hospital, and one of them is a German student. In general, very nice people and I'd love to work with them again. Comfortable and positive experience.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Sometimes the process requires more depending on the position. No questions were unexpected. Everyone was very nice. The phone interview lasted about 10 minutes. It was just a quick screening to see if I had the basic experience needed. They emailed me the next day for a 1:1 interview. Within a week after my 1:1 I was offered the position.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your work experience and how you feel it would benefit this position.

title: Research Scientist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Didnt have an interview since I just transitioned from Phd to research scientist. Most of the departments will do the same to help students till they can find a job.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Field Interviewer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Tampa, FL) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: I found the interview process to be a good combination of professionalism and friendliness. Interviewers were wonderful women that I would enjoy knowing better. The location was fairly easy to find even though I was unfamaliar with area.
Interview Questions: How to deal with a supervisior or co-worker that you do not get along with.

title: Telefund Caller Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: Easy group interview. Go through script. Make sure to know the script as much as possible. As they will ask you questions about it. Also, be outgoing. You will be able to stand out in the process. The people who interview you are students. It is very low key and you do not need to worry much.
Interview Questions: When was one time that you were involved in a team?

title: Patient Services Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: First you do a phone interview, then you take a customer service exam, then you have a third interview, and then a preliminary offer. Know that you will (9 times out of 10) only get an interview if someone personally recommends you. Also, you have to pretty much be over qualified for them to consider you.
Interview Questions: they asked about a lot of experiences where you have dealt with the bad...management, patients, co-workers, etc. be prepared to make yourself sound like a saint.

title: Patient Service Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI)
Interview Descriptions: Apply online.. received a call from HR for interview (but first you will have to complete PEP program prior in applying). Phone interview first, then in person, sometimes a second or third interview depends on department.
Interview Questions: What makes you unique out of all of the candidates

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI)
Interview Descriptions: Contacted through email first. After a few emails back and forth with a recruiter, I was able to get an in-person interview. The person I interviewed with was very nice and gave me a broad overview of the position. They are very flexible with hours and taking time off. I really liked working for UofM. Wish more jobs would open up.
Interview Questions: Unexpected questions was, "what didn't you like about your previous supervisor?"

title: Graduate Student Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Met the Dean, Graduate Coordinator, 4 additional faculty members in my research area and 2 current graduate students. Each interview was between 30-45 minutes. Casual but questions were specific to my background and my career interest.
Interview Questions: Why are you leaving your current school for Michigan?

title: Event Management Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: they put you in a large room then you filled out a form, and then you were sent to speak to two of the superiors. they then give you a position and email you a form, after filling it out, you attend training.
Interview Questions: situational

title: Media Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied through the student-life website. My employer contacted me the next day to set up an interview. I interviewed at the School of Education and was offered employed within a week.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work in the School of Education?

title: Marketing & Communications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied online as an external candidate for a position that was closing in 1 day. I received an email the very next day saying that I had been chosen to move to the next step in the process which was a phone interview. The phone interview was scheduled for the following week and would end up lasting about 30-35 minutes. The interview was very standardized as with most public/government organizations. There were standard things the interviewer shared with me like the fact that in the event they chose me for the position I would have to submit to a thorough background check which would include reference checks and degree verification. What I like about UofM is that their hiring system is decentralized and you don't have to make it past an hr screening to get to the people you'll be working for. Resumes go directly to the hiring manager, so in my opinion you are more likely to get an interview if you have transferable skill sets that match the position rather than work history in a similar position.  Smart hiring managers can read between the lines and will understand how your skills can translate. After the phone interview I received an email that said I would be moving on the second round which was a face to face interview that would last an hour. At the interview I was required to bring a portfolio and I was asked behavior based questions as well as questions related to the specific position.  At the end of the interview I was told that I would hear back in a week. I heard back probably two to three weeks later letting me know that I would not be offered the position. I was told that I needed more experience but that they enjoyed my enthusiasm and my well put together portfolio.
Interview Questions: Describe a decision you made that was unpopular and how you handled implementing it.

title: Academic Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: In Person interview with intense questions on your style with dealing with students who may have trouble grasping academic concepts. There are also questions built to gauge your level of integrity, I could say that this interview was fairly intense.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Lead Setup Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: Was more of a casual conversation in order to gauge the mentality rather than the skill. Most of the workers are part time so they would rather not have any issues between one another.
Interview Questions: Have you ever set up A/V?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: I found the job online on the umich student employment website and applied there. Received an email about scheduling an interview. It was a very easy interview. Found out I was hired a week or two later.
Interview Questions: What skills do you have that will be applicable to this position?

title: Lab Manager/Research Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI)
Interview Descriptions: Done by PI or Business Manager. Applied online at UMjobs.org. PI contacted me directly. Asked basic questions. Got an offer within two days. Be aware that PIs are generally the direct supervisor (the one you report to) and Business Managers will take of admin stuff (timesheets, etc).
Interview Questions: Basic questions. Strengths/weakness. Asked about former job experiences. Problem solving examples.

title: GSRA Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: No interview. It is based on your application document. If you have good research experience it  is a plus. High GPA is also a plus. Published papers a plus.
Interview Questions: No interview so no questions.

title: Assistant Teacher Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was very casual. I was given the questions ahead of time so I could prepare. It was a very conversational atmosphere, with little stress. No right or wrong answers, just wanted to see my thinking. Overall, a pleasant experience.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a conflict between two children?

title: Office of Technology Transfer Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Face to face interview on resume and past accomplishments to see how good of a fit the candidate is regarding a diverse background and skillset
Interview Questions: How do you think you will be contributing to the OTT Fellows program different than otger grad students in the University?

title: Research Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI)
Interview Descriptions: This was a stunningly unprofessional interview. I was invited to campus following a phone interview and then told they would only cover $500. No one told me that cab fare from the airport would be $60-70 (each way). Also, they gave me less than 2 weeks notice, so airfare wasn't cheap. I had asked for a copy of the full grant proposal but it wasn't emailed until late afternoon the day before I was to fly out, at 5 am. Upon reading it I nearly cancelled, because there were a number of red flags. When queried, the director gave answers that were plausible. I decided to go because I thought it would at least be a networking opportunity, because there were to be more people interviewing me than were at the phone interview. It wasn't. In fact, there were only a few interviewers, 3 I believe, and two had been on the phone interview. And, I had to do a presentation, which I spent time preparing. I flew in and out in one day for no more than a one hour interview. Had to find my own way around campus, find some lunch, etc. I did get a short tour of the building, but then of course had to call my own cab to get to the airport. The only thing I got from the interview was that (a) they already knew who they were hiring (not me) and (b) the director would be a terrible "boss."
Interview Questions: Nothing terribly difficult or unexpected. All rather perfunctory and canned.

title: Leo Lecturer II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI)
Interview Descriptions: Online application with letter and cv, email request for teaching materials and student evaluations, phone interview,  email set up face-to-face interview, interview with 3-5 individuals, offer letter.
Interview Questions: Describe your teaching pedagogy and what you do in the classroom, with assignments and activities and learning outcomes that reflect that philosophy.

title: Assistant Director of Annual Giving Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 7 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Phone interview, then on-campus interview.  Very standard interview process, there were no surprises.  Interviewers can be hesitant to be open to industry-switching candidates.

In the on-campus interview, it was a series of four interviews with all different team members.  The phone interview was a one-on-one with the hiring manager.
Interview Questions: What is one time you have failed, and what did you learn from it?

title: Tech Desk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Detroit, MI) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Very short interview, they basically hired anyone they could find because they were low on employees. They said they would call back but I knew I had the job before I left the building. I heard it was harder to get the job after a few months of my interview because they had people to fill all the necessary roles.
Interview Questions: Name, Why they should hire you, Qualifications, Basic Operating System Questions. Also asked about your future.

title: Research Area Specialist Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was somewhat long. You interview with several people and the process can take up to a month or longer depending on the position. The interviewers were friendly and put me at ease.
Interview Questions: What makes you qualified for this position.

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applied online via the University of Michigan employment website, in-person interview with two of the managers in a conference room, easy, talked about previous job experience and schooling. Manager described job position and negotiated hourly wage.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you handled a tough customer service situation

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Only interviewed over the phone to apologize that they gave job to someone else. There were no questions but really only a "courtesy" call since I had done work for this unit for many years.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Information Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applied online after a friend recommended the position. Basic questions asking what you would add to the position, what the most frequently asked questions might be from visitors/students/Ann Arbor residents. Asked to come in for an interview where you rotated rooms to speak to different student employees.
Interview Questions: Give us an example of a time where you've gone above and beyond the call of duty?

title: PSA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Northville, MI) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applied online took about 4 to 6 weeks. I had a phone interview, came in for testing. Then I had an interview with a manager, then I had an interview with another manager. The overall process was very thorough. They did an extensive background check and did several tests.
Interview Questions: What do you consider great customer service

title: Marketing/Graphic Design Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Applied early online and was called about 30 minutes later to meet in person. When I came to town about a month later, we looked over my portfolio, got the lowdown on the internship, and was offered the position. Very friendly and relaxed environment.
Interview Questions: How does your work as a student translate to the work you want to do with us?

title: Student Affairs Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Three interviews, kind people, competitive!  200+ candidates.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: West Quad Housing: Student Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: I applied through the University of Michigan's very simple and easy-to-use Student Employment website. About a week after I submitted, I received an email inviting me to an interview on site and checking if I was okay to work certain days and times of the week. I took this as a positive sign, and sure enough, the interview was very straightforward; I think they were just looking to hire people right away, and they anticipated that for many students, this would be their first job.
Interview Questions: What is the biggest challenge you expect to face in this job, and how will you overcome it?

title: Physical Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI)
Interview Descriptions: Patient scenario question. Goals. Where do you see yourself in 10 years?  Difficult patient interaction.
Interview Questions: Pretty standard.

title: Software Engineer Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: One phone tech interview
Interview Questions: implement a queue using stacks

title: Web Designer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: it was easier than expected. People are nice, they first introduced me themselves, and their projects. they did not proactively asked me to show them what i did. but i said i will show them.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Applications Programmer/Analyst Intermediate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: Initial contact within 2 weeks of applying for the job. First interview via phone, second and third via videoconference. I was an out of state candidate and I think the second and/or third could have been onsite for local, in-state candidates. The interview chair kept me up-to-date on the various stages of the interview. All three stages of the interview were complete within 2 weeks and a decision made witihin a further two weeks for a total of 1 month since initial contact. Overall, very pleasant experience interviewing with UMich.
Interview Questions: None actually.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was pretty much what you would expect.  I applied by sending an email.  I went to the researcher's office, I toured the lab (which was fun), and then we spoke for a little bit.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Senior Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed after phone screening.  I met with key personnel and  given a facility tour.The Principal Investigator let me give a presentation of my research in front of future lab team. They asked some professional questions.
Interview Questions: What's your professional expertise that can contribute their research group?

title: Trainer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview, then group interview with training manager.  Group interview was easy presentation on any topic of your choice. Hiring process was long it took almost 3 months to complete as they are a bit unorganized at time on the project.
Interview Questions: 5 minute presentation

title: OUD, Prospect Development and Analytics - Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions:
Round 1:
Individual interview:
Few common behavioral questions such as why D-SIP, what is the most interesting job you have ever done etc

Group discussion: 
Read an article about philanthropy and voice out your opinion in a group discussion.  

Get selected for round 2 but have not yet attended the interview.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time where you follow your curiosity.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Michigan in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Since a graduate student. Was admitted to the program. No interview was conducted. But some of the graduate student, especially for international students, school will have an interview before make an offer decision
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed for a semester-long research project with the School of Nursing. The faculty member there was very courteous and prompt with scheduling my interview. I was among a stack of around 30+ resumes for four positions. I heard back in a few weeks after she interviewed all of the candidates.
Interview Questions: The interview was a straight-forward set of behavioral questions. Most were specific to the job description. For example: tell me about when you were assertive, or tell me about what's not on your resume. It was a good experience in interview practice as she used questions I've seen before. It ultimately came down to previous work experience as many candidates were interested in the learning experience the job provided.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview was easy they look for people who are dedicated and are passionate about theu niversity of michigan and its mission. know about current campaigns that are taking place and you shoudl be good to go
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you worked on a team

title: Graduate Student Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: There was no interview process, as this GSRA position was offered directly from faculty advisor, as is typical in university Ph.D. programs. The faculty advisor asked/offered the two-semester GSRA position, a job that any Ph.D. student would be foolish to turn down, as it means you get a break from teaching (this is highly dependent on the program and university, of course). But generally, seems there is little interviewing that takes place for GSRA positions.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Student Food Service Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: university housing office for interview and application. Then, they will assign you to different dining hall for service according to your accessibility and overall circumstances.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Janitor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Minneapolis, MN) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: I went there and talked to the people about how much I love cleaning up after dirty people I don't mind cleaning toilets I don't mind shoveling snow taking out the trash
Interview Questions: What did expect from this job

title: Graduate Student Instructor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process depends on the department.  Officially, interviews are typically not required.  The application process just consists of submitting a resume, cover letter, references, etc.  If you are chosen to be hired, you then fill out all of the legal paperwork for taxes, health care, etc.  Unofficially, prior to submitting an application, many people start networking the prior semester, a few months before applications are due.  This involves emailing the professors, meeting with them to discuss their interests, your skill set, etc.
Interview Questions: There weren't any interviews, and the application questions are all straightforward.  No surprises, really.

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Submitted my CV, interviewed with the Dean and got the offer.
Interview Questions: there were not very difficult question.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Email, Recommended asked from advisor, then phone interview, finally visited on site. Met group members. Gave a seminar. Got an offer in two months.
Interview Questions: What is your career plans

title: Transfer Connections Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan (New York, NY) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: A group interview and a single interview was needed. Solo interviews are done with the manager and one current student employee. Very chill and relaxed, they genuinely want you to be the best that you can be.
Interview Questions: What is your biggest weakness

title: Resident Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: There is a group interview and an individual interview, following an electronic submission. It's a little unfriendly because the interviewers are both typing your answers on their laptops. (Also having seen the other side of these interviews, DEFINITELY still look at them instead of looking away. It is easy to do so becasue they aren't looking at you most of the time, but pretend that you are making eye contact with them anyway). It is also distracting becasue they may put you in a room with another person. Hopefully, they'll change that in the future.
Interview Questions: Explain a time that you interacted with diversity

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Campus interview from a professor. About 50+ students got this inteview. Ask about research experience in details, walk through cv, no other technical questions. there is a recorder as back up
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Housing Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions:
Student starting wage of $9.00/hour
     - Schedules that work around your classes
     - Discounted student meal
     - Potential for advancement to student manager positions
     - Valuable work experience to your resume
     - Chance to meet new people and have fun at work
     - No experience necessary!
     - Work Study and Non-Work Study positions available
Interview Questions: You don't have to have any experience.

title: Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: CV submission by email plus referral from other university employees. This followed by an “in office” interview with a panel of employees and the supervisor. As an international trainee the process took several months between decision, posting and paperwork.
Interview Questions: Q: What are your goals for this step in your career and how this will impact your long term plans?

title: Work-Study Administrative Assistant Job Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Michigan in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions:
I submitted my resume via the student employment website and was called and invited for an interview. I was in an interview with two people and the questions were fairly straightforward. I just talked about why I was interested in that position and how my experiences have helped me in terms of customer service as well as dealing with tedious tasks like data entry. I was kind of awkward about making eye contact with both of them and we were in a tight space more or less. I tried to ask questions about what I would be doing and answering their questions in as straightforward a manner as I could. 

Bring your resume!!
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position? Can you handle potentially long boring data entry work?

title: Event Management Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my application last September, interviewed about a month later on the phone, got called in for an in-person interview a couple of weeks later. The interview lasted about 45 minutes and was pretty intense. There were two people interviewing me, but they were really nice and friendly so even though it felt intimidating it wasn't too bad. They asked pretty standard questions, and then ended up referring me to another department. I did another interview with the new department and got the job a few days later.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you have been innovative in a job.

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Group interview with other coordinators in that therapeutic group, then 1:1 with hiring manager. Approximately 1.5 hours in length.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you did not meet or almost did not meet a deadline and why.

title: Account Executive Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: Casual conversation with the Business Manager. Lasted around 30 minutes found out about a week later. Mainly behavioral questions and an attempt to see how you can deal with customers/potential clients in person and on cold calls.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself? Are you comfortable walking into businesses and talking to managers?

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was really fast. I emailed the research sponsor at the end of my classes and got an immediate response. I emailed back immediately and he asked me if I could come in before he left work, so I ran over there as fast as I could. I was wearing casual clothes but they understood that. After that they asked me a couple questions about why I wanted to do research and plans about my career and some of my previous experience.
Interview Questions: What are your future plans?

title: Facilities Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: One on one interview with a lead facility coordinator for the athletic facilities at the University of Michigan. Basic interview, wanted to know a little bit of background and what made me a good fit for the position.
Interview Questions: What makes you qualified for this position?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Was asked simple questions about my resume, previous work experience, what my long term goals were. I was asked if I have any long term ambitions, whether I wish to advance in the department. I was honest and said that was my long term goal and that starting as an administrative assistant was a way I imagined to get my "foot in the door"
Interview Questions: There was no unexpected questions, it was a pretty straight forward interview.

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Contacted by email. Interview with all the graduate students, postdocs and research scientists in the group.
Interview Questions: What is your future career goal?

title: Graduate Student Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Michigan in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions:
Contact instructors that have openings for students.
Schedule an interview
Make sure you cover what are the areas of interest for the faculty
Come up with novel ideas to impress them
Show high motivation and promise
Interview Questions: - It is mainly about your research achievements, the number of publications you had in your past research area.

title: Desktop Support Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: Interview process at UM is long and tedious, especially for a job in IT. Talent in the IT field  is difficult to find and calling an interview 90+ days after resume submission is ridiculous... Technical skill never came up during interview.
Interview Questions: How do you make a peanut butter and jelly sandwich?sd

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: I found the description of the job on the employment posting website dedicated to Umich openings. I specifically used the filters to narrow down the posting options to those most relevant to me and my career interests. After submiting an online application, i received an email within a week from one of the Outreach Coordinators within the department asking me to send over a letter of interest and resume. A week later, I was contacted over the phone by the same coordinator to schedule an interview.
Interview Questions: The interview process isn't too difficult or stressful, so long as you come prepared to discuss your personal strengths and areas that you would like to improve on as well as why you are interest in the position and what you have to offer the department.

title: Graduate Student Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: Was selected based on application packet, there was no interview. I suppose portfolio and topicality of your work is what determines whether or not you will get matched up with faculty.
Interview Questions: There were no questions

title: Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions:
very casual, didn't even give a talk. 
Meet with the lab members, some gave suggestions that I wish I have followed. 
Overall, it's a easy interview and got offer right away. I think the boss made his decision even before the interview
Interview Questions: why do you choose this field since you have a completely different background?

title: IT Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: It took 5 months and 4 interviews, not because they had a lot of applicants but because they aren't organized. People were nice. First was a phone screen then met with HR in person then waited about 6 weeks and came in and met with team leads. Spoke to would be boss on the phone then bosses boss then came in and met both.
Interview Questions: What does philanthropy mean to you?

title: Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI)
Interview Descriptions: After receiving an email from the hiring person I went first through a phone interview and next visited Ann Arbor for an on-site interview. Both interviews were rather straightforward with nothing too surprising in terms of questions. I met with several faculty, toured the campus, and gave an hour-long seminar during the on-site interview. Overall the people I met were warm, approachable, and highly curious about my research. Very welcoming. The initial impression - consistent with my experience later - was that the school is full of very smart, yet down to earth and collaborative people, from deans and department chairs down to undergraduate students.
Interview Questions: No questions were particularly difficult or unexpected. I was asked about my plans and a timeline - the hiring person wanted to make sure that I would stay in the lab for at least 2 years.

title: Cashier Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: It was simple. They seen my application and needed to hire people quickly so I met the manager and it was easy from there. She showed me everything I needed to know. There really were no questions asked other than my availability
Interview Questions: I do not think there was an unexpected question

title: Administrative Assistant Intermediate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: 1/2 hour interview, Doctor talked about himself and his accomplishments for the first 20 minutes, including showing me the opulent 3rd home he was building with Google satellite.
Interview Questions: None.  Any interview questions about MY skills were almost an afterthought.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: After your online application and resume have been screened and selected, you meet directly with the principle investigator, who may be a physician scientist (MD) or research scientist (PhD). You speak to them about your interests and experiences. They talk a lot about their ongoing projects in the lab. If you are interested in their project, you can ask questions about specifics. You may get to meet with other members of the lab, such as post-docs and technicians. You can speak to them sometimes about their experiences and projects. Sometimes they give you a tour of the lab. You usually hear back with an offer to join the lab, within a week.
Interview Questions: Tell me more about previous research projects you have worked on and the techniques you have employed.

title: Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: Submitted resume directly to faculty hiring for the position. A few days later I was asked to come in person for interview that consisted of a research presentation and questions from faculty and other members of the research group. Very typical interview process for research related positions. Very friendly environment and the questions were focused on current research and how my skills would fit their future research goals. Nothing really difficult or out of the ordinary throughout the process.
Interview Questions: Questions closely related to research work and some questions to assess my fit with the rest of the research group. No quizzes, brain teasers or other skills tests.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and got contacted by the professor
Interview Questions: What is your honor thesis about

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was very simply. I went to my Professor's office where a friend of mine working for her introduced us. We then talked over why I chose her lab she explained her area of work and after talking for a while we saw we got along and I left her office with a job. She also explained that initially I would get very remedial tasks but as my experience grows and I get more of my tool training done I would be allowed to do more processing work.
Interview Questions: Basic question on my her lab and what are my interest nothing like a regular job interview. Much more casual.

title: Student Transit Coach Operator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: Basic questions, why do you want the job, what makes you qualified, etc. I recommend asking at the end if you have the position and also to make sure you can do the training ASAP and also try to drive in the summer before the traffic and students make it really hectic.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to drive buses?

title: Research Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at University of Michigan in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Brief -- It was unconventional since I had approached the employee on a different basis. The interview process itself was very informal and was very conversational. I was introduced to the project that I was expected to be working on for the summer.
Interview Questions: They asked what piqued my interest and whether i was available to work.

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Submitted my application to the professor I wanted to work for, the professor replied within a week and I was hired within 20 days of initial application. The process was pretty easy to go through and was pretty informal in nature. No real formalities. Pretty laid back. It was more about the science rather than other stuff.
Interview Questions: Met all lab members, presented my graduate work and was offered the position in a few days.

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: I was looking for a job during my undergrad, and I applied for this job through the University of Michigan career page. I sent in my resume and received an email scheduling an interview. I went onsite for the interview and talked with the interviewer (who was my manager after I began working) one on one. Afterwards she gave me a quick tour the facility. I received an email a couple days later offering me the job and I took it.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job?

title: Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: They had a face to face interview with me and responded back in a week. They were hiring for internship in research institute. Then they hired me for the systems analyst position where I supervised other research associates.
Interview Questions: They asked about my GIS experience.

title: I Work for the Medical School Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions:
* Applied online for multiple positions
* I was only contacted by those interested in interviewing me
* I had an initial phone interview then two in person interviews meeting my direct supervisor and the heads of the program
* HR was great once I was offered the position and they are amazing when it comes to figuring out and choosing benefits
Interview Questions: I don't recall there being a very difficult or unexpected question.

title: Medical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Michigan
Interview Descriptions: It was a very laid back hiring process. I was an intern at the hospital before I was hired and I basically counted that as a 4 month interview. They did not throw many questions at me, I believe I had more questions for them.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourselve in 10 years

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: I originally applied for the summer camp teacher assistant position and met with the director of the day care. This summer camp was for 1st-5th graders. The interview was one-on-one and very comfortable. Asked about personal experiences working with children and also asked how I would handle difficult situations. There were a few situational questions - how to handle children and also how to handle difficult parents. Also gave me a tour of the facility and was able to meet some of the teachers.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a difficult parent?

title: Applications Developer Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: On site with programming questions. Allowed to look up for help online, open question. The environment is very comfortable and relaxed. It lasted for about most of a day. If you have prepared for other institutions then these test questions should be moderately easy for you.
Interview Questions: Solve some common programming questions, and some open design questions.

title: Media Assistant - ISS Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: I sat down with the Desk Coordinator and a Team Lead and they asked me some questions about myself, my semester schedule, etc. Only one round of interviews because it was a student job. The supervisor was very kind, as was the student team lead that was sitting in. Overall, the interview was pretty easy.
Interview Questions: Is the customer always right?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: Met with the project manager of the project. She asked questions about my research and my plans for the future. She also informed me about the history of the project and the grander scheme for the project and my role. It was a very inquisitive and informative interview.
Interview Questions: What is your research experience and what are your plans for the future?

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: The professor asked me several questions about my background, my research and why I choose the University of Michigan. I answered those questions. Finally, I asked a question about the university and they answered it.
Interview Questions: Which department I am from. What's my research about.

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 12 months. I interviewed at University of Michigan (Ann Arbor, MI) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Recruited out of position, given an amazing speech about work life balance, security and how awesome it was there. All lies... get it in writing! Watch your back! Runaway, as fast as you can!
Interview Questions: Tell me about your work history

title: Web Applications Developer Interview
